trans-unit.source: He said, "My Lord, how will I have a boy when my wife has been barren and I have reached extreme old age?"
trans-unit.target: Dúirt sé, "Mo Thiarna, conas a bhfuil mé buachaill nuair mo bhean chéile a bhí barren agus mé tar éis teacht ar an aois mhór d'aois?"

trans-unit.source: [An angel] said, "Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, for I created you before, while you were nothing.' "
trans-unit.target: [Aingeal] dúirt sé, "Dá bhrí sin [beidh sé]; '. Tá sé éasca do Me, do chruthaigh mé leat sula, fad is a bhí tú rud ar bith' do Thiarna deir

trans-unit.source: [Zechariah] said, "My Lord, make for me a sign." He said, "Your sign is that you will not speak to the people for three nights, [being] sound."
trans-unit.target: [Zechariah] dúirt sé, "Mo Thiarna, a dhéanamh le haghaidh dom comhartha."

trans-unit.source: So he came out to his people from the prayer chamber and signaled to them to exalt [Allah] in the morning and afternoon.
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, tháinig sé amach ar a chuid daoine ón dlísheomra urnaí agus léirigh dóibh a exalt [Allah] ar maidin agus tráthnóna.

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "O John, take the Scripture with determination." And We gave him judgement [while yet] a boy
trans-unit.target: [Allah] dúirt sé, "O John, a chur ar an Scripture go diongbháilte."

trans-unit.source: And affection from Us and purity, and he was fearing of Allah
trans-unit.target: Ocus gean ó Linne agus íonachta, agus tá sé ag eagla Allah

trans-unit.source: And dutiful to his parents, and he was not a disobedient tyrant.
trans-unit.target: Agus dutiful a thuismitheoirí, agus ní raibh sé ina anfhlaith disobedient.

trans-unit.source: And peace be upon him the day he was born and the day he dies and the day he is raised alive.
trans-unit.target: Agus leis an tsíocháin a bheith air an lá a rugadh é agus an lá dtarlaí roimhe sin é agus an lá tá sé a ardaíodh beo.

trans-unit.source: And mention, [O Muhammad], in the Book [the story of] Mary, when she withdrew from her family to a place toward the east.
trans-unit.target: Agus lua, [O Muhammad], sa Leabhar [scéal] Muire, nuair a tharraing sí as a muintir go dtí áit i dtreo an taobh thoir.

trans-unit.source: And she took, in seclusion from them, a screen. Then We sent to her Our Angel, and he represented himself to her as a well-proportioned man.
trans-unit.target: Agus thóg sí, i seclusion uathu, scáileán.

trans-unit.source: She said, "Indeed, I seek refuge in the Most Merciful from you, [so leave me], if you should be fearing of Allah."
trans-unit.target: Dúirt sí, "Go deimhin, lorg mé dhídean sa chuid is mó trócaire ó tú, [mar sin fág mé], má ba chóir duit a bheith eagla ar Allah."

trans-unit.source: He said, "I am only the messenger of your Lord to give you [news of] a pure boy."
trans-unit.target: Dúirt sé, "Tá mé ach an teachtaire de do Tiarna a thabhairt duit [nuacht] buachaill íon."

trans-unit.source: She said, "How can I have a boy while no man has touched me and I have not been unchaste?"
trans-unit.target: Dúirt sí, "Conas is féidir liom a bheith buachaill cé go bhfuil aon fhear i dteagmháil léi dom agus ní raibh mé unchaste?"

trans-unit.source: He said, "Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, and We will make him a sign to the people and a mercy from Us. And it is a matter [already] decreed.' "
trans-unit.target: Dúirt sé, "Dá bhrí sin [beidh sé]; '.. Tá sé éasca do Mise, agus beidh muid a dhéanamh air séan ar na daoine agus a trócaire ó Linne Agus tá sé ina ábhar [cheana] decreed' do Thiarna deir

trans-unit.source: So she conceived him, and she withdrew with him to a remote place.
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, gur toircheadh leis í air, agus tharraing sí leis go dtí áit iargúlta.

trans-unit.source: And the pains of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a palm tree. She said, "Oh, I wish I had died before this and was in oblivion, forgotten."
trans-unit.target: Agus na pianta luí seoil thiomáin sí go dtí an trunk de chrann pailme.

trans-unit.source: But he called her from below her, "Do not grieve; your Lord has provided beneath you a stream.
trans-unit.target: Ach d'iarr sé uirthi ó thíos léi, "Ná Grieve; do Thiarna curtha ar fáil faoi bhun tú sruth.

trans-unit.source: And shake toward you the trunk of the palm tree; it will drop upon you ripe, fresh dates.
trans-unit.target: Agus croith i dtreo tú an stoc an chrainn pailme;

trans-unit.source: So eat and drink and be contented. And if you see from among humanity anyone, say, 'Indeed, I have vowed to the Most Merciful abstention, so I will not speak today to [any] man.' "
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, ithe agus ól agus a bheith sásta.

trans-unit.source: Then she brought him to her people, carrying him. They said, "O Mary, you have certainly done a thing unprecedented.
trans-unit.target: Ansin thug sí air a dhaoine, ag iompar air.

trans-unit.source: O sister of Aaron, your father was not a man of evil, nor was your mother unchaste."
trans-unit.target: O deirfiúr Aaron, ní raibh d'athair ina fhear de olc, ná ní raibh do mháthair unchaste. "

trans-unit.source: So she pointed to him. They said, "How can we speak to one who is in the cradle a child?"
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, dúirt sí dó.

trans-unit.source: [Jesus] said, "Indeed, I am the servant of Allah. He has given me the Scripture and made me a prophet.
trans-unit.target: [Íosa] dúirt sé, "Go deimhin, tá mé an seirbhíseach Allah. Tá sé tugtha dom an Scripture agus rinne mé fáidh.

trans-unit.source: And He has made me blessed wherever I am and has enjoined upon me prayer and zakah as long as I remain alive
trans-unit.target: Agus tá sé déanta beannaithe orm cibé áit mé agus tá enjoined orm urnaí agus zakah chomh fada is a fhanann mé beo

trans-unit.source: And [made me] dutiful to my mother, and He has not made me a wretched tyrant.
trans-unit.target: Agus [rinne mé] dutiful mo mháthair, agus nach bhfuil sé rinne mé anfhlaith wretched.

trans-unit.source: And peace is on me the day I was born and the day I will die and the day I am raised alive."
trans-unit.target: Agus is é an tsíocháin ar dom an lá a rugadh mé agus an lá a bheidh mé bás agus an lá mé a ardaíodh beo. "

trans-unit.source: That is Jesus, the son of Mary - the word of truth about which they are in dispute.
trans-unit.target: Is é sin Íosa, an mac Muire - an focal na fírinne ar a bhfuil siad faoi dhíospóid.

trans-unit.source: It is not [befitting] for Allah to take a son; exalted is He! When He decrees an affair, He only says to it, "Be," and it is.
trans-unit.target: Níl sé [befitting] do Allah a ghlacadh mac;

trans-unit.source: [Jesus said], "And indeed, Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. That is a straight path."
trans-unit.target: [Dúirt Íosa], "Agus go deimhin, is é Allah mo Thiarna agus do Thiarna, agus mar sin adhartha Eisean. Is é sin an bealach díreach."

trans-unit.source: Then the factions differed [concerning Jesus] from among them, so woe to those who disbelieved - from the scene of a tremendous Day.
trans-unit.target: Ansin difriúil na faicsin [maidir Íosa] as measc, mar sin mairg dóibh siúd a disbelieved - ó láthair ar Lá ollmhór.

trans-unit.source: How [clearly] they will hear and see the Day they come to Us, but the wrongdoers today are in clear error.
trans-unit.target: Conas [soiléir] gcluinfidh siad agus féach an Lá thagann siad chun Us, ach tá na agraíodh éagóiritheoirí feadh lá atá inniu ann trí dhearmad soiléir.

trans-unit.source: And warn them, [O Muhammad], of the Day of Regret, when the matter will be concluded; and [yet], they are in [a state of] heedlessness, and they do not believe.
trans-unit.target: Agus rabhadh a thabhairt dóibh, [O Muhammad], ar an Lá na aiféala, nuair a bheidh an t-ábhar a thabhairt i gcrích;

trans-unit.source: Indeed, it is We who will inherit the earth and whoever is on it, and to Us they will be returned.
trans-unit.target: Go deimhin, tá sé againn a hoidhreacht an domhain agus whoever is ar sé, agus a Us cuirfear ar ais.

trans-unit.source: And mention in the Book [the story of] Abraham. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.
trans-unit.target: Agus lua i Leabhar [an scéal] Abraham.

trans-unit.source: [Mention] when he said to his father, "O my father, why do you worship that which does not hear and does not see and will not benefit you at all?
trans-unit.target: [Luaigh] nuair a dúirt sé lena athair, "O mo athair, cén fáth a bhfuil tú ag adhradh nach bhfuil éisteacht agus ní a fheiceáil agus ní tairbhe tú ar chor ar bith?

trans-unit.source: O my father, indeed there has come to me of knowledge that which has not come to you, so follow me; I will guide you to an even path.
trans-unit.target: O mo athair, go deimhin, tá teacht chugam an eolais sin nach bhfuil a thagann tú, agus mar sin mé a leanúint;

trans-unit.source: O my father, do not worship Satan. Indeed Satan has ever been, to the Most Merciful, disobedient.
trans-unit.target: O mo athair, ná adhradh Satan.

trans-unit.source: O my father, indeed I fear that there will touch you a punishment from the Most Merciful so you would be to Satan a companion [in Hellfire]."
trans-unit.target: O mo athair, go deimhin, eagla orm go mbeidh dteagmháil leat pionós as an chuid is mó trócaire ionas go mbeadh tú a bheith go Satan chompánach [i Hellfire]. "

trans-unit.source: [His father] said, "Have you no desire for my gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist, I will surely stone you, so avoid me a prolonged time."
trans-unit.target: [A athair] dúirt sé, "An bhfuil tú aon dúil mo gods, O Abraham? Mura bhfuil tú scor, beidh mé cinnte cloch duit, mar sin a sheachaint dom tamaill fhada."

trans-unit.source: [Abraham] said, "Peace will be upon you. I will ask forgiveness for you of my Lord. Indeed, He is ever gracious to me.
trans-unit.target: [Abraham] dúirt sé, "Beidh Síocháin ar tú. Beidh mé ag iarraidh maithiúnas do shon mo Thiarna. Go deimhin, tá sé riamh gracious dom.

trans-unit.source: And I will leave you and those you invoke other than Allah and will invoke my Lord. I expect that I will not be in invocation to my Lord unhappy."
trans-unit.target: Agus beidh mé a fhágann tú agus iad siúd tú agairt ach amháin Allah agus beidh agairt mo Thiarna.

trans-unit.source: So when he had left them and those they worshipped other than Allah, We gave him Isaac and Jacob, and each [of them] We made a prophet.
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, nuair a d'fhág sé iad agus iad siúd adhradh siad seachas Allah, Thug muid dó Isaac agus Jacob, agus gach [ceann acu] Rinneamar fáidh.

trans-unit.source: And We gave them of Our mercy, and we made for them a reputation of high honor.
trans-unit.target: Agus thug muid dóibh ar ár trócaire, agus rinneamar dóibh cáil ar onóir ard.

trans-unit.source: And mention in the Book, Moses. Indeed, he was chosen, and he was a messenger and a prophet.
trans-unit.target: Agus lua sa Leabhar, Moses.

trans-unit.source: And We called him from the side of the mount at [his] right and brought him near, confiding [to him].
trans-unit.target: Agus d'iarr muid air ó thaobh an mount ag [a] ceart agus thug sé in aice le, confiding [dó].

trans-unit.source: And We gave him out of Our mercy his brother Aaron as a prophet.
trans-unit.target: Agus thug muid dó amach as ár trócaire a dheartháir Aaron mar fáidh.

trans-unit.source: And mention in the Book, Ishmael. Indeed, he was true to his promise, and he was a messenger and a prophet.
trans-unit.target: Agus lua sa Leabhar, Ishmael.

trans-unit.source: And he used to enjoin on his people prayer and zakah and was to his Lord pleasing.
trans-unit.target: Agus úsáid sé a enjoin ar a urnaí dhaoine agus zakah agus bhí a Thiarna taitneamhach.

trans-unit.source: And mention in the Book, Idrees. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.
trans-unit.target: Agus lua sa Leabhar, Idrees.

trans-unit.source: And We raised him to a high station.
trans-unit.target: Agus Bhailíomar leis go dtí stáisiún ard.

trans-unit.source: Those were the ones upon whom Allah bestowed favor from among the prophets of the descendants of Adam and of those We carried [in the ship] with Noah, and of the descendants of Abraham and Israel, and of those whom We guided and chose. When the verses of the Most Merciful were recited to them, they fell in prostration and weeping.
trans-unit.target: Bhí Glacfar na cinn ar ar Allah bestowed bhfabhar as measc na fáithe shliocht Adam agus na ndaoine Rinneamar [an long] le Noah, agus ar an sliocht Abraham agus Iosrael, agus na ndaoine a bhfuil treoraithe muid agus roghnaigh.

trans-unit.source: But there came after them successors who neglected prayer and pursued desires; so they are going to meet evil -
trans-unit.target: Ach ansin tháinig ina ndiaidh chomharbaí a ndearnadh faillí orthu paidir agus ar mian leis leanúint;

trans-unit.source: Except those who repent, believe and do righteousness; for those will enter Paradise and will not be wronged at all.
trans-unit.target: Ach amháin iad siúd a repent, creidim agus righteousness dhéanamh;

trans-unit.source: [Therein are] gardens of perpetual residence which the Most Merciful has promised His servants in the unseen. Indeed, His promise has ever been coming.
trans-unit.target: [Tá Ann] gairdíní cónaithe suthain a bhfuil an trócaire an chuid is mó geallta a seirbhísigh i unseen.

trans-unit.source: They will not hear therein any ill speech - only [greetings of] peace - and they will have their provision therein, morning and afternoon.
trans-unit.target: Ní bheidh siad ag éisteacht ann aon óráid droch - ach [beannachtaí de] síochána - agus beidh siad a soláthair ann, ar maidin agus tráthnóna.

trans-unit.source: That is Paradise, which We give as inheritance to those of Our servants who were fearing of Allah.
trans-unit.target: Is é sin Paradise, a thabhairt dúinn mar oidhreacht dóibh siúd ar ár seirbhíseach a bhí eagla ar Allah.

trans-unit.source: [Gabriel said], "And we [angels] descend not except by the order of your Lord. To Him belongs that before us and that behind us and what is in between. And never is your Lord forgetful -
trans-unit.target: . [Gabriel dúirt], "Agus muid [aingil] nach descend amháin leis an ordú de do Tiarna Chun Eisean mbaineann go roimh dúinn agus go taobh thiar dúinn agus cad i idir Agus riamh go bhfuil do Thiarna dearmadach. -

trans-unit.source: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them - so worship Him and have patience for His worship. Do you know of any similarity to Him?"
trans-unit.target: Tiarna na spéartha agus an talamh, agus is cuma cad é eatarthu - adhradh mar sin Eisean agus tá foighne le haghaidh a chuid adhradh.

trans-unit.source: And the disbeliever says, "When I have died, am I going to be brought forth alive?"
trans-unit.target: Agus deir an disbeliever, "Nuair a bheidh mé bás, tá mé ag dul a thabhairt amach beo?"

trans-unit.source: Does man not remember that We created him before, while he was nothing?
trans-unit.target: An fear nach cuimhnigh go Cruthaithe againn air roimh, nuair a bhí sé rud ar bith?

trans-unit.source: So by your Lord, We will surely gather them and the devils; then We will bring them to be present around Hell upon their knees.
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, le do Thiarna, beidh muid a bhailiú surely iad agus an diabhal;

trans-unit.source: Then We will surely extract from every sect those of them who were worst against the Most Merciful in insolence.
trans-unit.target: Ansin, beidh muid a bhaint surely ó gach sect siúd acu a bhí measa in aghaidh na chuid is mó trócaire in insolence.

trans-unit.source: Then, surely it is We who are most knowing of those most worthy of burning therein.
trans-unit.target: Ansin, surely is againn atá an chuid is mó a fhios agam de na daoine is mó fiú a dhó ann.

trans-unit.source: And there is none of you except he will come to it. This is upon your Lord an inevitability decreed.
trans-unit.target: Agus tá aon cheann de tú ach tiocfaidh sé leis.

trans-unit.source: Then We will save those who feared Allah and leave the wrongdoers within it, on their knees.
trans-unit.target: Ansin, beidh muid a shábháil dóibh siúd a eagla Allah agus fág an ciontóirí laistigh de sé, ar a n-knees.

trans-unit.source: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Which of [our] two parties is best in position and best in association?"
trans-unit.target: Agus nuair a againn véarsaí aithris dóibh evidences chomh soiléir, iad siúd a disbelieve rá dóibh siúd a chreideann, "Cé acu de [ár] dá pháirtí is fearr i suíomh agus is fearr i gcomhar?"

trans-unit.source: And how many a generation have We destroyed before them who were better in possessions and [outward] appearance?
trans-unit.target: Agus cé mhéad glúin scriosta muid os a a bhí níos fearr i sealúchais agus [amach] chuma?

trans-unit.source: Say, "Whoever is in error - let the Most Merciful extend for him an extension [in wealth and time] until, when they see that which they were promised - either punishment [in this world] or the Hour [of resurrection] - they will come to know who is worst in position and weaker in soldiers."
trans-unit.target: Abair, "An té is i earráid - lig an trócaire an chuid is mó a leathnú dó síneadh [in saibhreas agus am] go dtí, nuair a fheiceann siad go bhfuil a raibh siad geallta - bíodh pionós [sa saol seo] nó an Uair [an aiséirí] - siad

trans-unit.source: And Allah increases those who were guided, in guidance, and the enduring good deeds are better to your Lord for reward and better for recourse.
trans-unit.target: Agus méadaíonn Allah siúd treoraithe a bhfuil, treoir, agus na gníomhais buaine maith níos fearr a d'Thiarna luaíocht agus níos fearr do leas a bhaint as.

trans-unit.source: Then, have you seen he who disbelieved in Our verses and said, "I will surely be given wealth and children [in the next life]?"
trans-unit.target: Ansin, an bhfaca tú an té a disbelieved Inár véarsaí agus dúirt sé, "beidh mé ag a thabhairt surely saibhreas agus leanaí [sa saol seo chugainn]?"

trans-unit.source: Has he looked into the unseen, or has he taken from the Most Merciful a promise?
trans-unit.target: Tá fhéach sé go dtí an unseen, nó ghlac sé as an trócaire an chuid is mó gealltanas?

trans-unit.source: No! We will record what he says and extend for him from the punishment extensively.
trans-unit.target: Uimh!

trans-unit.source: And We will inherit him [in] what he mentions, and he will come to Us alone.
trans-unit.target: Agus beidh muid hoidhreacht air [i] cén luaitear sé, agus beidh sé ag teacht chun Us aonar.

trans-unit.source: And they have taken besides Allah [false] deities that they would be for them [a source of] honor.
trans-unit.target: Agus tá siad tógtha seachas Allah [bréagach] deities go mbeadh siad dóibh [fhoinse] onóir.

trans-unit.source: No! Those "gods" will deny their worship of them and will be against them opponents [on the Day of Judgement].
trans-unit.target: Uimh!

trans-unit.source: Do you not see that We have sent the devils upon the disbelievers, inciting them to [evil] with [constant] incitement?
trans-unit.target: nach bhfeiceann tú go bhfuil muid chuir an diabhal ar na disbelievers, iad a ghríosú chun [olc] le [tairiseach] gríosú?

trans-unit.source: So be not impatient over them. We only count out to them a [limited] number.
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, nach impatient os a gcionn.

trans-unit.source: On the Day We will gather the righteous to the Most Merciful as a delegation
trans-unit.target: Ar an Lá Déanfaimid bhailiú ar an righteous do na Daoine is trócaire mar thoscaireacht

trans-unit.source: And will drive the criminals to Hell in thirst
trans-unit.target: Agus beidh tiomáint an coirpigh go hIfreann i tart

trans-unit.source: None will have [power of] intercession except he who had taken from the Most Merciful a covenant.
trans-unit.target: Beidh aon cheann acu [cumhacht] idirghuí seachas é a thóg as na chuid is mó trócaire cúnant.

trans-unit.source: And they say, "The Most Merciful has taken [for Himself] a son."
trans-unit.target: Agus deir siad, "Tá an chuid is mó trócaire tar éis glacadh [do féin] mac."

trans-unit.source: You have done an atrocious thing.
trans-unit.target: Déanta agat ar rud atrocious.

trans-unit.source: The heavens almost rupture therefrom and the earth splits open and the mountains collapse in devastation
trans-unit.target: Na flaithis beagnach réabfaidh astu agus roinntear an domhan oscailte agus an tubaiste sléibhte i léirscrios

trans-unit.source: That they attribute to the Most Merciful a son.
trans-unit.target: Go tréith siad leis an chuid is mó trócaire mac.

trans-unit.source: And it is not appropriate for the Most Merciful that He should take a son.
trans-unit.target: Agus nach bhfuil sé oiriúnach don chuid is mó trócaire gur chóir sé a ghlacadh mac.

trans-unit.source: There is no one in the heavens and earth but that he comes to the Most Merciful as a servant.
trans-unit.target: Níl aon duine sna flaithis agus talamh, ach a thagann sé go dtí an chuid is mó trócaire mar sheirbhíseach.

trans-unit.source: He has enumerated them and counted them a [full] counting.
trans-unit.target: Tá sé áirithe iad agus a chomhaireamh iad a [iomlán] comhaireamh.

trans-unit.source: And all of them are coming to Him on the Day of Resurrection alone.
trans-unit.target: Agus gach ceann acu ag teacht a dó ar an Lá na Aiséirí amháin.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - the Most Merciful will appoint for them affection.
trans-unit.target: Go deimhin, iad siúd a bhfuil chreid agus a rinneadh gníomhais righteous - beidh an trócaire an chuid is mó a cheapadh dóibh gean.

trans-unit.source: So, [O Muhammad], We have only made Qur'an easy in the Arabic language that you may give good tidings thereby to the righteous and warn thereby a hostile people.
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, [O Muhammad], níl ach Rinneamar Qur'an éasca sa teanga Araibis gur féidir leat a thabhairt do dtuairisc maith amhlaidh leis an righteous agus rabhadh dá réir a daoine naimhdeach.

trans-unit.source: And how many have We destroyed before them of generations? Do you perceive of them anyone or hear from them a sound?
trans-unit.target: Agus cé mhéad a bheith scriosta againn os a gcomhair na nglún?

trans-unit.source: Ta, Ha.
trans-unit.target: Ta, Ha.

trans-unit.source: We have not sent down to you the Qur'an that you be distressed
trans-unit.target: Ní mór dúinn a sheoladh síos a thabhairt duit an Qur'an go bhfuil tú a bheith suaite

trans-unit.source: But only as a reminder for those who fear [Allah] -
trans-unit.target: Ach amháin mar i gcuimhne dóibh siúd a eagla [Allah] -

trans-unit.source: A revelation from He who created the earth and highest heavens,
trans-unit.target: A revelation ó An té a chruthaigh an domhain agus flaithis is airde,

trans-unit.source: The Most Merciful [who is] above the Throne established.
trans-unit.target: An trócaire is mó [atá] os cionn an Throne bunaithe.

trans-unit.source: To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is on the earth and what is between them and what is under the soil.
trans-unit.target: Chun Eisean mbaineann a bhfuil sna flaithis agus an méid atá ar an domhain agus a bhfuil idir iad agus an méid atá faoi ithir.

trans-unit.source: And if you speak aloud - then indeed, He knows the secret and what is [even] more hidden.
trans-unit.target: Agus má labhraíonn tú os ard - ansin go deimhin, a fhios aige an rún agus a bhfuil [fiú] níos mó i bhfolach.

trans-unit.source: Allah - there is no deity except Him. To Him belong the best names.
trans-unit.target: Allah - níl aon deity ach amháin Eisean.

trans-unit.source: And has the story of Moses reached you? -
trans-unit.target: Agus tá an scéal Moses shroich tú?

trans-unit.source: When he saw a fire and said to his family, "Stay here; indeed, I have perceived a fire; perhaps I can bring you a torch or find at the fire some guidance."
trans-unit.target: Nuair a chonaic sé tine agus dúirt a chlann, "Fan anseo; go deimhin, tá mé a bhraitear tine; b'fhéidir gur féidir liom a thabhairt duit tóirse nó a fháil ar an tine treoir éigin."

trans-unit.source: And when he came to it, he was called, "O Moses,
trans-unit.target: Agus nuair a tháinig sé chun é, uime do gairthí, "O Moses,

trans-unit.source: Indeed, I am your Lord, so remove your sandals. Indeed, you are in the sacred valley of Tuwa.
trans-unit.target: Go deimhin, tá mé do Thiarna, agus mar sin a bhaint do sandals.

trans-unit.source: And I have chosen you, so listen to what is revealed [to you].
trans-unit.target: Agus Roghnaigh mé tú, agus mar sin éisteacht leis an méid atá le fios [chugat].

trans-unit.source: Indeed, I am Allah. There is no deity except Me, so worship Me and establish prayer for My remembrance.
trans-unit.target: Go deimhin, tá mé Allah.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the Hour is coming - I almost conceal it - so that every soul may be recompensed according to that for which it strives.
trans-unit.target: Go deimhin, tá an Uair ag teacht - cheilt mé beagnach sé - ionas gur féidir gach anam a gcúitítear réir sin a déanann sé.

trans-unit.source: So do not let one avert you from it who does not believe in it and follows his desire, for you [then] would perish.
trans-unit.target: Ní Mar sin, ná lig duine sheachaint tú ó sé nach bhfuil a chreideann i leanas é, agus a mhian, ar do shon [ansin] bheadh crith.

trans-unit.source: And what is that in your right hand, O Moses?"
trans-unit.target: Agus cad é sin i do lámh dheas, O Moses? "

trans-unit.source: He said, "It is my staff; I lean upon it, and I bring down leaves for my sheep and I have therein other uses."
trans-unit.target: Dúirt sé, "Is é mo fhoireann; lean mé air, agus a thabhairt mé síos duilleoga do mo chaoirigh agus mé ann úsáidí eile."

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "Throw it down, O Moses."
trans-unit.target: [Allah] dúirt sé, "Caith sé síos, O Moses."

trans-unit.source: So he threw it down, and thereupon it was a snake, moving swiftly.
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, chaith sé sé síos, agus air go raibh sé ina nathair, ag gluaiseacht go tapa.

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "Seize it and fear not; We will return it to its former condition.
trans-unit.target: [Allah] dúirt sé, "a thiocfaidh as é agus ní eagla; Déanfaimid sé ar ais sa riocht ina raibh.

trans-unit.source: And draw in your hand to your side; it will come out white without disease - another sign,
trans-unit.target: Agus tarraing i do lámh le do thaobh;

trans-unit.source: That We may show you [some] of Our greater signs.
trans-unit.target: Gur féidir linn a thaispeáint duit [cuid] de Ár comharthaí níos mó.

trans-unit.source: Go to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed."
trans-unit.target: Téigh go dtí Pharaoh.

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "My Lord, expand for me my breast [with assurance]
trans-unit.target: [Maois] dúirt sé, "Mo Thiarna, a leathnú go dtí mé mo chléibh [le dearbhú]

trans-unit.source: And ease for me my task
trans-unit.target: Agus éasca dom mo tasc

trans-unit.source: And untie the knot from my tongue
trans-unit.target: Agus Scaoil an snaidhm ó mo theanga

trans-unit.source: That they may understand my speech.
trans-unit.target: Gur féidir leo a thuiscint mo chaint.

trans-unit.source: And appoint for me a minister from my family -
trans-unit.target: Agus cheapadh dom aire ó mo theaghlach -

trans-unit.source: Aaron, my brother.
trans-unit.target: Aaron, mo dheartháir.

trans-unit.source: Increase through him my strength
trans-unit.target: Méadú trí dó mo neart

trans-unit.source: And let him share my task
trans-unit.target: Agus lig dó a roinnt mo tasc

trans-unit.source: That we may exalt You much
trans-unit.target: Gur féidir linn exalt tú i bhfad

trans-unit.source: And remember You much.
trans-unit.target: Agus cuimhnigh tú i bhfad.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, You are of us ever Seeing."
trans-unit.target: Go deimhin, Tá tú duine againn Seeing riamh. "

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "You have been granted your request, O Moses.
trans-unit.target: [Allah] dúirt sé, "Tá tú ar deonaíodh d'iarratas, O Moses.

trans-unit.source: And We had already conferred favor upon you another time,
trans-unit.target: Agus bhí muid a thugtar cheana dtús báire ar tú am eile,

trans-unit.source: When We inspired to your mother what We inspired,
trans-unit.target: Nuair spreag muid le do mháthair cad a spreag muid,

trans-unit.source: [Saying], 'Cast him into the chest and cast it into the river, and the river will throw it onto the bank; there will take him an enemy to Me and an enemy to him.' And I bestowed upon you love from Me that you would be brought up under My eye.
trans-unit.target: [Ag rá], 'Cast air isteach an cófra agus chaith sé isteach ar an abhainn, agus beidh an abhainn a chaitheamh isteach ar an banc;

trans-unit.source: [And We favored you] when your sister went and said, 'Shall I direct you to someone who will be responsible for him?' So We restored you to your mother that she might be content and not grieve. And you killed someone, but We saved you from retaliation and tried you with a [severe] trial. And you remained [some] years among the people of Madyan. Then you came [here] at the decreed time, O Moses.
trans-unit.target: [Agus bail ar fónamh againn go mbainfidh tú] nuair a chuaigh do dheirfiúr agus dúirt: "Beidh mé tú a threorú chuig duine éigin cé a bheidh freagrach as dó? '

trans-unit.source: And I produced you for Myself.
trans-unit.target: Agus a tháirgtear mé tú Mise.

trans-unit.source: Go, you and your brother, with My signs and do not slacken in My remembrance.
trans-unit.target: Téigh, tú féin agus do dheartháir, le mo comharthaí agus nach slacken i My gcuimhne.

trans-unit.source: Go, both of you, to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed.
trans-unit.target: Téigh, dá de tú, go Pharaoh.

trans-unit.source: And speak to him with gentle speech that perhaps he may be reminded or fear [Allah]."
trans-unit.target: Agus labhairt dó leis an chaint milis go mb'fhéidir féadfar é a chur i gcuimhne nó eagla [Allah]. "

trans-unit.source: They said, "Our Lord, indeed we are afraid that he will hasten [punishment] against us or that he will transgress."
trans-unit.target: Dúirt siad, "Ár dTiarna, go deimhin, tá muid eagla go mbeidh sé hasten [pionós] aghaidh linn nó go ndéanfaidh sé transgress."

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "Fear not. Indeed, I am with you both; I hear and I see.
trans-unit.target: [Allah] dúirt sé, "Fear nach deimhin, tá mé in éineacht leat an dá. Cloisim agus feicim.

trans-unit.source: So go to him and say, 'Indeed, we are messengers of your Lord, so send with us the Children of Israel and do not torment them. We have come to you with a sign from your Lord. And peace will be upon he who follows the guidance.
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, dul dó agus a rá, 'Go deimhin, tá muid teachtairí de do Thiarna, mar sin seol linn na Leanaí ar Iosrael agus nach crá iad.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, it has been revealed to us that the punishment will be upon whoever denies and turns away.' "
trans-unit.target: Go deimhin, tá sé le fios dúinn go mbeidh an pionós a bheith ar whoever denies agus casadh ar shiúl. '

trans-unit.source: [Pharaoh] said, "So who is the Lord of you two, O Moses?"
trans-unit.target: [Pharaoh] dúirt sé, "Mar sin, is an Tiarna de tú dhá, O Moses?"

trans-unit.source: He said, "Our Lord is He who gave each thing its form and then guided [it]."
trans-unit.target: Dúirt sé, "Is é ár dTiarna té a thug gach rud a fhoirm agus ansin treoraithe [é]."

trans-unit.source: [Pharaoh] said, "Then what is the case of the former generations?"
trans-unit.target: [Pharaoh] dúirt sé, "Ansin, cad é an cás na glúnta iar-?"

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "The knowledge thereof is with my Lord in a record. My Lord neither errs nor forgets."
trans-unit.target: [Maois] dúirt sé, "Is é an t-eolas sin le mo Thiarna i dtaifead. Mo Thiarna errs luach ná ní déan dearmad de."

trans-unit.source: [It is He] who has made for you the earth as a bed [spread out] and inserted therein for you roadways and sent down from the sky, rain and produced thereby categories of various plants.
trans-unit.target: [Is sé] a rinne tú an domhan mar leaba [leathadh amach] agus cuireadh isteach ann ar do shon ar bhóithre agus a sheoladh síos ón spéir, báisteach agus a tháirgtear sa tslí sin gcatagóirí de phlandaí éagsúla.

trans-unit.source: Eat [therefrom] and pasture your livestock. Indeed, in that are signs for those of intelligence.
trans-unit.target: Eat [aisti] agus fhéarach do bheostoc.

trans-unit.source: From the earth We created you, and into it We will return you, and from it We will extract you another time.
trans-unit.target: As an domhain Cruthaithe againn tú, agus isteach é Fillfimid leat, agus as é Déanfaimid sliocht tú am eile.

trans-unit.source: And We certainly showed Pharaoh Our signs - all of them - but he denied and refused.
trans-unit.target: Agus léirigh muid cinnte Pharaoh Ár comharthaí - gach ceann acu - ach shéan sé agus diúltaíodh.

trans-unit.source: He said, "Have you come to us to drive us out of our land with your magic, O Moses?
trans-unit.target: Dúirt sé, "An bhfuil tú ag teacht chugainn a thiomáint dúinn amach as ár dtalamh le do draíochta, O Moses?

trans-unit.source: Then we will surely bring you magic like it, so make between us and you an appointment, which we will not fail to keep and neither will you, in a place assigned."
trans-unit.target: Ansin, beidh muid a thabhairt surely tú draíocht maith liom é, mar sin déan idir dúinn agus coinne, ach ní bheidh muid ag theipeann a choinneáil agus ní bheidh tú, in áit a shanntar. "

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "Your appointment is on the day of the festival when the people assemble at mid-morning."
trans-unit.target: [Maois] dúirt sé, "Tá do cheapachán ar an lá na féile nuair assemble na daoine i lár na maidine."

trans-unit.source: So Pharaoh went away, put together his plan, and then came [to Moses].
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, chuaigh Pharaoh ar shiúl, a chur le chéile a phlean, agus ansin tháinig [do Mhaois].

trans-unit.source: Moses said to the magicians summoned by Pharaoh, "Woe to you! Do not invent a lie against Allah or He will exterminate you with a punishment; and he has failed who invents [such falsehood]."
trans-unit.target: Moses dúirt leis na magicians thoghairm ag Pharaoh, "Mairg a thabhairt duit Ná chumadh a bheidh i gcoinne Allah nó beidh sé exterminate tú le pionós;!., Agus gur mhainnigh sé a invents [fiaradh sórt]"

trans-unit.source: So they disputed over their affair among themselves and concealed their private conversation.
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, Dhíospóid siad thar a affair eatarthu féin agus folaithe a comhrá príobháideach.

trans-unit.source: They said, "Indeed, these are two magicians who want to drive you out of your land with their magic and do away with your most exemplary way.
trans-unit.target: Dúirt siad, "Go deimhin, tá an dá magicians ar mian leo a thiomáint tú amach as do thalamh lena n-draíochta agus a dhéanamh ar shiúl le do bhealach is eiseamláireach.

trans-unit.source: So resolve upon your plan and then come [forward] in line. And he has succeeded today who overcomes."
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, a réiteach ar do phlean agus ansin teacht [tosaigh] ag teacht.

trans-unit.source: They said, "O Moses, either you throw or we will be the first to throw."
trans-unit.target: Dúirt siad, "O Moses, bíodh caith tú nó beidh muid a bheith ar an gcéad a caith."

trans-unit.source: He said, "Rather, you throw." And suddenly their ropes and staffs seemed to him from their magic that they were moving [like snakes].
trans-unit.target: Dúirt sé, "Ina ionad sin, is féidir leat caith."

trans-unit.source: And he sensed within himself apprehension, did Moses.
trans-unit.target: Agus airigh sé laistigh de féin apprehension, rinne Moses.

trans-unit.source: Allah said, "Fear not. Indeed, it is you who are superior.
trans-unit.target: Allah dúirt sé, "Fear nach. Go deimhin, is tú atá níos fearr.

trans-unit.source: And throw what is in your right hand; it will swallow up what they have crafted. What they have crafted is but the trick of a magician, and the magician will not succeed wherever he is."
trans-unit.target: Agus caith a bhfuil i do lámh dheas;

trans-unit.source: So the magicians fell down in prostration. They said, "We have believed in the Lord of Aaron and Moses."
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, thit na magicians síos sa faonluí.

trans-unit.source: [Pharaoh] said, "You believed him before I gave you permission. Indeed, he is your leader who has taught you magic. So I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will crucify you on the trunks of palm trees, and you will surely know which of us is more severe in [giving] punishment and more enduring."
trans-unit.target: [Pharaoh] dúirt sé, "chreid tú dó roimh thug mé tú cead. Go deimhin, tá sé do cheannaire a mhúin draíocht leat. Mar sin, beidh mé ag a ghearradh surely a bhaint de do lámha agus do chosa ar an taobh thall, agus beidh mé crucify tú ar an trunks

trans-unit.source: They said, "Never will we prefer you over what has come to us of clear proofs and [over] He who created us. So decree whatever you are to decree. You can only decree for this worldly life.
trans-unit.target: Dúirt siad, "Ná cuirfimid fearr leat níos mó ná an méid atá teacht chugainn cruthúnas soiléir agus [níos mó] An té a chruthaigh sinn. Mar sin, is cuma cad foraithne bhfuil tú chun foraithne. Is féidir leat foraithne ach amháin le haghaidh an saol worldly.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, we have believed in our Lord that He may forgive us our sins and what you compelled us [to do] of magic. And Allah is better and more enduring."
trans-unit.target: Go deimhin, ní mór dúinn a chreid inár dTiarna gur Féadfaidh sé maith dhúinn ár bpeacaí agus cad a iallach tú dúinn [a dhéanamh] draíochta.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, whoever comes to his Lord as a criminal - indeed, for him is Hell; he will neither die therein nor live.
trans-unit.target: Go deimhin, is cuma cé a thagann a Thiarna mar coiriúil - go deimhin, mar tá sé ifreann;

trans-unit.source: But whoever comes to Him as a believer having done righteous deeds - for those will be the highest degrees [in position]:
trans-unit.target: Ach tagann whoever a dó mar believer a bheith déanta gníomhais righteous - d'beidh na a bheith ar an céimeanna is airde [sa phost]:

trans-unit.source: Gardens of perpetual residence beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. And that is the reward of one who purifies himself.
trans-unit.target: Gairdíní chónaithe suthain faoi bhun a aibhneacha sreabhadh, wherein gcloíonn siad eternally.

trans-unit.source: And We had inspired to Moses, "Travel by night with My servants and strike for them a dry path through the sea; you will not fear being overtaken [by Pharaoh] nor be afraid [of drowning]."
trans-unit.target: Agus bhí spreag againn Moses, "Taisteal san oíche le mo sheirbhísigh agus stailc dóibh cosán tirim tríd an bhfarraige; ní bheidh ort eagla á overtaken [ag Pharaoh] ná bíodh eagla ort [bá]."

trans-unit.source: So Pharaoh pursued them with his soldiers, and there covered them from the sea that which covered them,
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, sa tóir Pharaoh iad lena saighdiúirí, agus clúdaithe iad ón bhfarraige go a chlúdaigh siad,

trans-unit.source: And Pharaoh led his people astray and did not guide [them].
trans-unit.target: Agus Pharaoh stiúir chuid daoine ar strae agus ní raibh treoir [iad].

trans-unit.source: O Children of Israel, We delivered you from your enemy, and We made an appointment with you at the right side of the mount, and We sent down to you manna and quails,
trans-unit.target: O Leanaí ar Iosrael, a sheachadadh againn go mbainfidh tú ó do namhaid, agus rinne muid coinne a bhfuil tú ag an taobh dheis de na Mount, agus chuir muid síos a thabhairt duit manna agus gearga,

trans-unit.source: [Saying], "Eat from the good things with which We have provided you and do not transgress [or oppress others] therein, lest My anger should descend upon you. And he upon whom My anger descends has certainly fallen."
trans-unit.target: [Ag rá], "Eat ó na rudaí maith leis a bhfuil muid ar fáil duit agus ná transgress [nó do dhaoine eile oppress] ann, lest ba chóir mo fearg téigh síos ar tú. Agus sé ar ar descends mo fearg tar éis titim cinnte."

trans-unit.source: But indeed, I am the Perpetual Forgiver of whoever repents and believes and does righteousness and then continues in guidance.
trans-unit.target: Ach go deimhin, tá mé an Forgiver Síor ar whoever repents agus creideann agus ní righteousness agus ansin leanann treoir.

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "And what made you hasten from your people, O Moses?"
trans-unit.target: [Allah] dúirt sé, "Agus cad a rinne tú hasten as do dhaoine, O Moses?"

trans-unit.source: He said, "They are close upon my tracks, and I hastened to You, my Lord, that You be pleased."
trans-unit.target: Dúirt sé, "Tá siad gar ar mo rianta, agus léimeas tú, mo Thiarna, go tú a bheith sásta."

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "But indeed, We have tried your people after you [departed], and the Samiri has led them astray."
trans-unit.target: [Allah] dúirt sé, "Ach go deimhin, Tá iarracht déanta againn do dhaoine tar éis duit [imigh], agus an Samiri thoradh orthu astray."

trans-unit.source: So Moses returned to his people, angry and grieved. He said, "O my people, did your Lord not make you a good promise? Then, was the time [of its fulfillment] too long for you, or did you wish that wrath from your Lord descend upon you, so you broke your promise [of obedience] to me?"
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, Moses ar ais chuig a mhuintir, feargach agus grieved.

trans-unit.source: They said, "We did not break our promise to you by our will, but we were made to carry burdens from the ornaments of the people [of Pharaoh], so we threw them [into the fire], and thus did the Samiri throw."
trans-unit.target: Dúirt siad, "Ní raibh muid sos ár gealltanas a thabhairt duit ag ár toil, ach bhí déanta againn chun ualaigh a iompar ó na ornáidí na ndaoine [de Pharaoh], agus mar sin chaith muid iad [isteach sa tine], agus dá bhrí sin ní raibh an caith Samiri

trans-unit.source: And he extracted for them [the statue of] a calf which had a lowing sound, and they said, "This is your god and the god of Moses, but he forgot."
trans-unit.target: Agus bhaintear sé dóibh [an dealbh de] lao a raibh fuaim méid seo, agus dúirt siad, "Tá sé seo do Dia agus an Dia an Moses, ach Forgot sé."

trans-unit.source: Did they not see that it could not return to them any speech and that it did not possess for them any harm or benefit?
trans-unit.target: Ní raibh siad a fheiceáil nach bhféadfadh sí filleadh dóibh aon urlabhra agus nach raibh sé go mbeadh dóibh aon díobháil nó sochar?

trans-unit.source: And Aaron had already told them before [the return of Moses], "O my people, you are only being tested by it, and indeed, your Lord is the Most Merciful, so follow me and obey my order."
trans-unit.target: Agus d'inis Aaron cheana féin iad roimh [ar ais Moses], "O mo mhuintir, tá tú á thástáil amháin aige, agus go deimhin, tá do Thiarna na chuid is mó trócaire, agus mar sin mé a leanúint agus obey mo ordú."

trans-unit.source: They said, "We will never cease being devoted to the calf until Moses returns to us."
trans-unit.target: Dúirt siad, "Ní bheidh muid a thuilleadh á dírithe ar an lao go dtí go bhfilleann Moses a chur chugainn."

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "O Aaron, what prevented you, when you saw them going astray,
trans-unit.target: [Maois] dúirt sé, "O Aaron, cad a chosc tú, nuair a chonaic tú iad ag dul amú,

trans-unit.source: From following me? Then have you disobeyed my order?"
trans-unit.target: Ó mo leanúint?

trans-unit.source: [Aaron] said, "O son of my mother, do not seize [me] by my beard or by my head. Indeed, I feared that you would say, 'You caused division among the Children of Israel, and you did not observe [or await] my word.' "
trans-unit.target: [Aaron] dúirt sé, "O mac mo mháthair, nach urghabháil [mé] ag mo féasóg nó mo cheann. Go deimhin, eagla orm go mbeadh tú a rá, 'ba chúis tú roinn i measc na Leanaí ar Iosrael, agus ní raibh tú ag breathnú

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "And what is your case, O Samiri?"
trans-unit.target: [Maois] dúirt sé, "Agus cad é do chás, O Samiri?"

trans-unit.source: He said, "I saw what they did not see, so I took a handful [of dust] from the track of the messenger and threw it, and thus did my soul entice me."
trans-unit.target: Dúirt sé, "a chonaic mé cad nach raibh siad a fheiceáil, mar sin ghlac mé dornán [deannaigh] ón riain an teachtaire agus chaith sé, agus dá bhrí sin raibh m'anam mhealladh dom."

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "Then go. And indeed, it is [decreed] for you in [this] life to say, 'No contact.' And indeed, you have an appointment [in the Hereafter] you will not fail to keep. And look at your 'god' to which you remained devoted. We will surely burn it and blow it into the sea with a blast.
trans-unit.target: [Maois] dúirt sé, "Ansin dul. Agus go deimhin, tá sé [decreed] do shon san [seo] saol a rá, 'Ní hea teagmháil.'

trans-unit.source: Your god is only Allah, except for whom there is no deity. He has encompassed all things in knowledge."
trans-unit.target: Tá do Dia ach Allah, ach amháin i gcás, ná fuil aon deity.

trans-unit.source: Thus, [O Muhammad], We relate to you from the news of what has preceded. And We have certainly given you from Us the Qur'an.
trans-unit.target: Dá bhrí sin, [O Muhammad], baineann daoibh as an nuacht ar a bhfuil roimh.

trans-unit.source: Whoever turns away from it - then indeed, he will bear on the Day of Resurrection a burden,
trans-unit.target: Whoever casadh ar shiúl ó sé - ansin go deimhin, beidh sé i bhfeidhm ar an Lá na Aiséirí ualach,

trans-unit.source: [Abiding] eternally therein, and evil it is for them on the Day of Resurrection as a load -
trans-unit.target: [Géilliúil] eternally ann, agus olc go bhfuil sé dóibh ar an Lá na Aiséirí mar ualach -

trans-unit.source: The Day the Horn will be blown. And We will gather the criminals, that Day, blue-eyed.
trans-unit.target: An Lá a bheidh an Corn blown.

trans-unit.source: They will murmur among themselves, "You remained not but ten [days in the world]."
trans-unit.target: Beidh siad Crónán eatarthu féin, "Ní fhan tú ach deich [laethanta ar fud an domhain]."

trans-unit.source: We are most knowing of what they say when the best of them in manner will say, "You remained not but one day."
trans-unit.target: Táimid mó a fhios agam an méid a deir siad nuair a bheidh an chuid is fearr acu sa tslí a rá, "Ní fhan tú ach lá amháin."

trans-unit.source: And they ask you about the mountains, so say, "My Lord will blow them away with a blast.
trans-unit.target: Agus iarrann siad duit faoi na sléibhte, mar sin a rá, "Beidh mo Thiarna iad buille ar shiúl le soinneáin.

trans-unit.source: And He will leave the earth a level plain;
trans-unit.target: Agus beidh sé a fhágáil ar an domhan plain leibhéal;

trans-unit.source: You will not see therein a depression or an elevation."
trans-unit.target: Ní fheicfidh tú ann le dúlagar nó ingearchló. "

trans-unit.source: That Day, everyone will follow [the call of] the Caller [with] no deviation therefrom, and [all] voices will be stilled before the Most Merciful, so you will not hear except a whisper [of footsteps].
trans-unit.target: Go Lá, beidh gach duine a leanúint [an glaoch ar] an glaoiteoir [le] gan aon diall uathu, agus beidh [uile] guthanna a stilled roimh an chuid is mó trócaire, mar sin ní bheidh tú ag éisteacht ach amháin cogar [de footsteps].

trans-unit.source: That Day, no intercession will benefit except [that of] one to whom the Most Merciful has given permission and has accepted his word.
trans-unit.target: Go Lá, ní bheidh aon idirghuí tairbhe ach amháin [go] duine lena mbaineann an trócaire an chuid is mó tá cead tugtha agus tar éis glacadh leis a chuid focal.

trans-unit.source: Allah knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, but they do not encompass it in knowledge.
trans-unit.target: Allah fhios cad é [láthair] os a gcomhair agus cad a bheidh i ndiaidh dóibh, ach ní dhéanann siad gcuimseodh sé in eolas.

trans-unit.source: And [all] faces will be humbled before the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of existence. And he will have failed who carries injustice.
trans-unit.target: Agus beidh [uile] aghaidheanna a humbled roimh or-maireachtála, an Sustainer ann.

trans-unit.source: But he who does of righteous deeds while he is a believer - he will neither fear injustice nor deprivation.
trans-unit.target: Ach an té a dhéanann na gníomhais righteous linn dó bheith ina believer - déanfaidh sé eagla ní éagóir ná díothacht.

trans-unit.source: And thus We have sent it down as an Arabic Qur'an and have diversified therein the warnings that perhaps they will avoid [sin] or it would cause them remembrance.
trans-unit.target: Agus dá bhrí sin tá muid chuir sé síos mar Qur'an Araibis agus tá éagsúlaithe ann na rabhaidh sin b'fhéidir go mbeidh siad a sheachaint [pheaca] nó go mbeadh sé faoi deara iad Cuimhneachán.

trans-unit.source: So high [above all] is Allah, the Sovereign, the Truth. And, [O Muhammad], do not hasten with [recitation of] the Qur'an before its revelation is completed to you, and say, "My Lord, increase me in knowledge."
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, ard [thar aon rud eile] Allah, an Fhlaitheasacha, an fhírinne.

trans-unit.source: And We had already taken a promise from Adam before, but he forgot; and We found not in him determination.
trans-unit.target: Agus má rinne muid cheana féin gealltanas ó Ádhamh roimh, ach Forgot sé;

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except Iblees; he refused.
trans-unit.target: Agus [lua] nuair a dúirt muid go dtí an aingeal, "faonlag go Adam," agus prostrated siad, ach amháin Iblees;

trans-unit.source: So We said, "O Adam, indeed this is an enemy to you and to your wife. Then let him not remove you from Paradise so you would suffer.
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, dúirt muid, "O Adam, go deimhin, is é seo an namhaid a thabhairt duit agus do do bhean chéile. Ansin lig dó bain tú as Paradise ionas go mbeadh tú ag fulaingt.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, it is [promised] for you not to be hungry therein or be unclothed.
trans-unit.target: Go deimhin, tá sé [geallta] do shon gan a bheith ocras sa Teach sin nó a bheith unclothed.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, you will not be thirsty therein or be hot from the sun."
trans-unit.target: Agus go deimhin, ní bheidh tú in tart ann nó a bheith te ón ngrian. "

trans-unit.source: Then Satan whispered to him; he said, "O Adam, shall I direct you to the tree of eternity and possession that will not deteriorate?"
trans-unit.target: Ansin dúirt Satan dó;

trans-unit.source: And Adam and his wife ate of it, and their private parts became apparent to them, and they began to fasten over themselves from the leaves of Paradise. And Adam disobeyed his Lord and erred.
trans-unit.target: Agus Adam agus a bhean chéile ith é, agus a n-áiteanna príobháideacha ba léir dóibh, agus thosaigh siad a iamh thar iad féin ó dhuillí Paradise.

trans-unit.source: Then his Lord chose him and turned to him in forgiveness and guided [him].
trans-unit.target: Ansin roghnaigh a Thiarna air agus chas dó i maithiúnas agus treoraithe [dó].

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "Descend from Paradise - all, [your descendants] being enemies to one another. And if there should come to you guidance from Me - then whoever follows My guidance will neither go astray [in the world] nor suffer [in the Hereafter].
trans-unit.target: [Allah] dúirt sé, "Tar anuas ó Paradise -. Ar fad, [do sliocht] naimhde á chéile Agus má ba chóir go thagann tú treoir ó Me - ansin whoever leanas Beidh mo treoir ná dul go astray [fud an domhain] ná ag fulaingt [

trans-unit.source: And whoever turns away from My remembrance - indeed, he will have a depressed life, and We will gather him on the Day of Resurrection blind."
trans-unit.target: Agus whoever casadh ar shiúl ó mo Cuimhneachán - go deimhin, beidh sé go mbeadh saol depressed, agus beidh muid a bhailiú dó ar an Lá na Aiséirí dall ".

trans-unit.source: He will say, "My Lord, why have you raised me blind while I was [once] seeing?"
trans-unit.target: Beidh sé ag rá, "Mo Thiarna, cén fáth go bhfuil a ardaíodh tú dall dom nuair a bhí mé [uair amháin] bhfaca?"

trans-unit.source: [Allah] will say, "Thus did Our signs come to you, and you forgot them; and thus will you this Day be forgotten."
trans-unit.target: [Allah] a rá, "Dá bhrí sin raibh ár comharthaí a thagann tú, agus tú dearmad iad. Agus dá bhrí sin beidh tú an lá dearmad"

trans-unit.source: And thus do We recompense he who transgressed and did not believe in the signs of his Lord. And the punishment of the Hereafter is more severe and more enduring.
trans-unit.target: Agus dá bhrí sin chuirimid recompense té a transgressed agus nár chreid i na comharthaí a Thiarna.

trans-unit.source: Then, has it not become clear to them how many generations We destroyed before them as they walk among their dwellings? Indeed in that are signs for those of intelligence.
trans-unit.target: Ansin, tá sé nach bhfuil a bheith soiléir dóibh cé mhéad glúnta scrios muid rompu iad ag siúl i measc a teaghaisí?

trans-unit.source: And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord, punishment would have been an obligation [due immediately], and [if not for] a specified term [decreed].
trans-unit.target: Agus más rud é nach focal a roimh ó do Thiarna, bheadh pionós a bheith oibleagáid [dlite láithreach], agus [más rud é nach ar feadh] feadh téarma shonraithe [decreed].

trans-unit.source: So be patient over what they say and exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting; and during periods of the night [exalt Him] and at the ends of the day, that you may be satisfied.
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, a n-othar níos mó ná an méid a deir siad agus exalt [Allah] le moladh do Tiarna roimh éirí na gréine agus roimh a suíomh;

trans-unit.source: And do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to [some] categories of them, [its being but] the splendor of worldly life by which We test them. And the provision of your Lord is better and more enduring.
trans-unit.target: Agus ná leathnú do shúile i dtreo go bhfuil ag a bhfuil againn taitneamh thugtar [cuid] chatagóirí acu, [a á ach] an splendour an tsaoil worldly trína Táimid iad a thástáil.

trans-unit.source: And enjoin prayer upon your family [and people] and be steadfast therein. We ask you not for provision; We provide for you, and the [best] outcome is for [those of] righteousness.
trans-unit.target: Agus enjoin paidir ar do theaghlach [agus do dhaoine] agus a buanseasmhach ann.

trans-unit.source: And they say, "Why does he not bring us a sign from his Lord?" Has there not come to them evidence of what was in the former scriptures?
trans-unit.target: Agus deir siad, "Cén fáth nach bhfuil sé a thabhairt dúinn comhartha óna Thiarna?"

trans-unit.source: And if We had destroyed them with a punishment before him, they would have said, "Our Lord, why did You not send to us a messenger so we could have followed Your verses before we were humiliated and disgraced?"
trans-unit.target: Agus dá mbeadh scriosta muid iad le pionós os a chomhair, bheadh siad ag rá, "Ár dTiarna, cén fáth nach sheoladh chugainn teachtaire ionas gur féidir linn a bheith le leanúint Do véarsaí sula raibh humiliated againn agus disgraced?"

trans-unit.source: Say, "Each [of us] is waiting; so wait. For you will know who are the companions of the sound path and who is guided."
trans-unit.target: Abair, "Gach [duine againn] ag fanacht; mar sin fanacht Do mbeidh a fhios agat cé hiad na compánaigh an cosán fuaime agus atá treoraithe.."

trans-unit.source: [The time of] their account has approached for the people, while they are in heedlessness turning away.
trans-unit.target: Tá [an t-am ar] a gcuntas i dteagmháil do na daoine, cé go bhfuil siad i heedlessness casadh ar shiúl.

trans-unit.source: No mention comes to them anew from their Lord except that they listen to it while they are at play
trans-unit.target: Tagann Uimh lua leo as an nua as a n-Tiarna amháin go n-éisteann siad leis cé go bhfuil siad ag súgradh

trans-unit.source: With their hearts distracted. And those who do wrong conceal their private conversation, [saying], "Is this [Prophet] except a human being like you? So would you approach magic while you are aware [of it]?"
trans-unit.target: Lena n-hearts distracted.

trans-unit.source: The Prophet said, "My Lord knows whatever is said throughout the heaven and earth, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing."
trans-unit.target: An Prophet dúirt sé, "Mo Tiarna a fhios cuma cad é a dúirt le linn na neamh agus talamh, agus tá sé an Éisteacht, an fhios agam."

trans-unit.source: But they say, "[The revelation is but] a mixture of false dreams; rather, he has invented it; rather, he is a poet. So let him bring us a sign just as the previous [messengers] were sent [with miracles]."
trans-unit.target: Ach deir siad, "[Is é an revelation ach] meascán de aisling bréagach; in áit, tá chum sé é; in áit, tá sé ina fhile Mar sin in iúl dó a thabhairt dúinn comhartha díreach mar cuireadh an [teachtairí] roimhe seo [le míorúiltí.

trans-unit.source: Not a [single] city which We destroyed believed before them, so will they believe?
trans-unit.target: Ní [singil] chathair a scrios muid chreid os a gcomhair, a fhágann go mbeidh a chreideann siad?

trans-unit.source: And We sent not before you, [O Muhammad], except men to whom We revealed [the message], so ask the people of the message if you do not know.
trans-unit.target: Agus ní chuir muid roimh tú, [O Muhammad], ach amháin na fir a bhfuil fios againn [an teachtaireacht], agus mar sin iarraidh ar mhuintir an teachtaireacht más rud é nach bhfuil a fhios agat.

trans-unit.source: And We did not make the prophets forms not eating food, nor were they immortal [on earth].
trans-unit.target: Agus ní raibh muid a dhéanamh ar na fáithe foirmeacha nach bhfuil ag ithe bia, ná ní raibh bás a fháil siad [ar domhan].

trans-unit.source: Then We fulfilled for them the promise, and We saved them and whom We willed and destroyed the transgressors.
trans-unit.target: Ansin chomhlíon muid dóibh an gealltanas, agus a shábháil muid iad agus cé willed muid agus scrios an transgressors.

trans-unit.source: We have certainly sent down to you a Book in which is your mention. Then will you not reason?
trans-unit.target: Táimid tar éis a sheoladh cinnte síos a thabhairt duit Leabhar ina bhfuil do lua.

trans-unit.source: And how many a city which was unjust have We shattered and produced after it another people.
trans-unit.target: Agus cé mhéad cathair a bhí éagórach bhfuil shattered muid agus a tháirgtear ina dhiaidh daoine a chéile.

trans-unit.source: And when its inhabitants perceived Our punishment, at once they fled from it.
trans-unit.target: Mhothuigh a áitritheoirí Ár pionós, ag an am céanna theith siad as é.

trans-unit.source: [Some angels said], "Do not flee but return to where you were given luxury and to your homes - perhaps you will be questioned."
trans-unit.target: [Roinnt aingeal dúirt], "Ná teitheadh ach filleadh ar áit a raibh tú só a tugadh agus do thithe -. B'fhéidir go mbeidh tú a cheistiú"

trans-unit.source: They said, "O woe to us! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."
trans-unit.target: Dúirt siad, "O mairg dúinn! Go deimhin, bhí muid agraíodh éagóiritheoirí."

trans-unit.source: And that declaration of theirs did not cease until We made them [as] a harvest [mowed down], extinguished [like a fire].
trans-unit.target: Agus ní raibh dearbhú inniúlacht siúd deireadh go dtí Rinneamar iad [mar] fómhar [mowed síos], múchfar [nós tine].

trans-unit.source: And We did not create the heaven and earth and that between them in play.
trans-unit.target: Agus ní raibh muid a chruthú ar an neamh agus talamh agus go bhfuil idir iad i spraoi.

trans-unit.source: Had We intended to take a diversion, We could have taken it from [what is] with Us - if [indeed] We were to do so.
trans-unit.target: Bhí sé i gceist againn a ghlacadh atreorú, d'fhéadfadh muid a bheith déanta air ó [a bhfuil] le Linn - más rud é [deimhin] Bhí muid é sin a dhéanamh.

trans-unit.source: Rather, We dash the truth upon falsehood, and it destroys it, and thereupon it departs. And for you is destruction from that which you describe.
trans-unit.target: Ina ionad sin, Táimid ag Fleasc an fhírinne ar fiaradh, agus milleann sé é, agus air imíonn sé.

trans-unit.source: To Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and the earth. And those near Him are not prevented by arrogance from His worship, nor do they tire.
trans-unit.target: Chun Eisean mbaineann pé duine atá sna spéartha agus an talamh.

trans-unit.source: They exalt [Him] night and day [and] do not slacken.
trans-unit.target: exalt siad [Eisean] oíche agus lá [agus] ná slacken.

trans-unit.source: Or have men taken for themselves gods from the earth who resurrect [the dead]?
trans-unit.target: Nó tá fir a glacadh dóibh féin gods as an domhain a athmhúscailt [an marbh]?

trans-unit.source: Had there been within the heavens and earth gods besides Allah, they both would have been ruined. So exalted is Allah, Lord of the Throne, above what they describe.
trans-unit.target: Dá mbeadh laistigh de na flaithis agus déithe cré seachas Allah, bheadh siad araon a bheith scriosta.

trans-unit.source: He is not questioned about what He does, but they will be questioned.
trans-unit.target: Nach bhfuil sé cheistiú faoi na rudaí a dhéanann sé, ach beidh siad a cheistiú.

trans-unit.source: Or have they taken gods besides Him? Say, [O Muhammad], "Produce your proof. This [Qur'an] is the message for those with me and the message of those before me." But most of them do not know the truth, so they are turning away.
trans-unit.target: Nó a bheith déanta acu déithe seachas Eisean?

trans-unit.source: And We sent not before you any messenger except that We revealed to him that, "There is no deity except Me, so worship Me."
trans-unit.target: Agus ní chuir muid roimh tú aon teachtaire amháin gur léirigh muid dó go, "Níl aon deity amháin Me, mar sin adhradh Me."

trans-unit.source: And they say, "The Most Merciful has taken a son." Exalted is He! Rather, they are [but] honored servants.
trans-unit.target: Agus deir siad, "Tá an chuid is mó trócaire tar éis glacadh mac."

trans-unit.source: They cannot precede Him in word, and they act by His command.
trans-unit.target: Ní féidir leo roimh dó i focal, agus feidhmíonn siad ag a ordú.

trans-unit.source: He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, and they cannot intercede except on behalf of one whom He approves. And they, from fear of Him, are apprehensive.
trans-unit.target: Tá a fhios aige cad é [láthair] os a gcomhair agus cad a bheidh i ndiaidh dóibh, agus ní féidir leo intercede amháin thar ceann acu bhformheasfaidh sé.

trans-unit.source: And whoever of them should say, "Indeed, I am a god besides Him"- that one We would recompense with Hell. Thus do We recompense the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: Agus whoever acu ba chóir a rá, "Go deimhin, tá mé Dia seachas Eisean" - go bhfuil ceann Ba mhaith linn recompense le Ifreann.

trans-unit.source: Have those who disbelieved not considered that the heavens and the earth were a joined entity, and We separated them and made from water every living thing? Then will they not believe?
trans-unit.target: An bhfuil siúd nach disbelieved a mheas go bhfuil na spéartha agus an talamh a bhí aonán chuaigh, agus scartha muid iad agus déanta as uisce gach rud beo?

trans-unit.source: And We placed within the earth firmly set mountains, lest it should shift with them, and We made therein [mountain] passes [as] roads that they might be guided.
trans-unit.target: Agus chuir muid taobh istigh den domhan atá leagtha go daingean sléibhte, lest ba chóir é a athrú leo, agus rinne muid ann [sliabh] Gabhann [mar] bóithre go bhféadfadh siad a bheith treoraithe.

trans-unit.source: And We made the sky a protected ceiling, but they, from its signs, are turning away.
trans-unit.target: Agus rinne muid an spéir uasteorainn cosanta, ach tá siad, óna comharthaí, atá ag casadh ar shiúl.

trans-unit.source: And it is He who created the night and the day and the sun and the moon; all [heavenly bodies] in an orbit are swimming.
trans-unit.target: Agus tá sé té a chruthaigh an oíche agus an lá agus an ghrian agus an ghealach;

trans-unit.source: And We did not grant to any man before you eternity [on earth]; so if you die - would they be eternal?
trans-unit.target: Agus ní raibh muid dheonú d'aon fhear sula Eternity tú [ar an talamh];

trans-unit.source: Every soul will taste death. And We test you with evil and with good as trial; and to Us you will be returned.
trans-unit.target: Déanfar gach anam blas bás.

trans-unit.source: And when those who disbelieve see you, [O Muhammad], they take you not except in ridicule, [saying], "Is this the one who insults your gods?" And they are, at the mention of the Most Merciful, disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Agus nuair a iad siúd a disbelieve fheiceann tú, [O Muhammad], a ghlacann siad tú ach amháin i magadh, [ag rá], "An é seo an ceann a maslaí do déithe?"

trans-unit.source: Man was created of haste. I will show you My signs, so do not impatiently urge Me.
trans-unit.target: Cuireadh Fear cruthaíodh de haste.

trans-unit.source: And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"
trans-unit.target: Agus deir siad, "Nuair a bhíonn an gealltanas, má ba chóir duit a bheith fírinneach?"

trans-unit.source: If those who disbelieved but knew the time when they will not avert the Fire from their faces or from their backs and they will not be aided...
trans-unit.target: Má siúd a disbelieved ach bhí a fhios an t-am nuair nach mbeidh siad a sheachaint an Dóiteáin as a n-aghaidh nó ó a ndroim agus ní bheidh siad a cúnamh ...

trans-unit.source: Rather, it will come to them unexpectedly and bewilder them, and they will not be able to repel it, nor will they be reprieved.
trans-unit.target: Ina ionad sin, beidh sé teacht chucu gan choinne agus iad sach, agus ní bheidh siad in ann a repel air, ná ní bheidh siad a reprieved.

trans-unit.source: And already were messengers ridiculed before you, but those who mocked them were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
trans-unit.target: Agus bhí cheana féin teachtairí ridiculed roimh tú, ach iad siúd a mocked iad a bhí enveloped ag an méid a úsáidtear iad chun magadh.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Who can protect you at night or by day from the Most Merciful?" But they are, from the remembrance of their Lord, turning away.
trans-unit.target: Abair, "Cé is féidir leat a chosaint ar an oíche nó i rith an lae ó na chuid is mó trócaire?"

trans-unit.source: Or do they have gods to defend them other than Us? They are unable [even] to help themselves, nor can they be protected from Us.
trans-unit.target: Nó an bhfuil siad déithe a chosaint dóibh, seachas Linn?

trans-unit.source: But, [on the contrary], We have provided good things for these [disbelievers] and their fathers until life was prolonged for them. Then do they not see that We set upon the land, reducing it from its borders? So it is they who will overcome?
trans-unit.target: Ach, [ar a mhalairt], tá muid ar fáil rudaí maithe do na [disbelievers] agus a n-aithreacha dtí saol a bhí fada dóibh.

trans-unit.source: Say, "I only warn you by revelation." But the deaf do not hear the call when they are warned.
trans-unit.target: Abair, "rabhadh mé ach tú ag revelation."

trans-unit.source: And if [as much as] a whiff of the punishment of your Lord should touch them, they would surely say, "O woe to us! Indeed, we have been wrongdoers."
trans-unit.target: Agus más rud é [an oiread agus is] Ba cheart whiff de pionósú do Thiarna teagmháil leo, bheadh siad ag rá go cinnte, "O mairg dúinn! Go deimhin, ní mór dúinn a bheith agraíodh éagóiritheoirí feadh."

trans-unit.source: And We place the scales of justice for the Day of Resurrection, so no soul will be treated unjustly at all. And if there is [even] the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it forth. And sufficient are We as accountant.
trans-unit.target: Agus Cuirimid na scálaí an cheartais do Lá na Aiséirí, mar sin ní bheidh aon anam a chóireáil unjustly ar chor ar bith.

trans-unit.source: And We had already given Moses and Aaron the criterion and a light and a reminder for the righteous
trans-unit.target: Agus bhí muid tugtha cheana féin Maois agus Árón na critéir agus éadrom agus i gcuimhne do na righteous

trans-unit.source: Who fear their Lord unseen, while they are of the Hour apprehensive.
trans-unit.target: Cé eagla an Tiarna unseen, cé go bhfuil siad ar an Uair apprehensive.

trans-unit.source: And this [Qur'an] is a blessed message which We have sent down. Then are you with it unacquainted?
trans-unit.target: Agus seo é teachtaireacht bheannaigh atá againn sheoladh síos [Qur'an].

trans-unit.source: And We had certainly given Abraham his sound judgement before, and We were of him well-Knowing
trans-unit.target: Agus bhí muid tugtha cinnte Abraham a bhreithiúnas fuaime roimh, agus bhí muid ar air agus-Ós eol

trans-unit.source: When he said to his father and his people, "What are these statues to which you are devoted?"
trans-unit.target: Nuair a dúirt sé lena athair agus a mhuintir, "Cad iad na dealbha a bhfuil tú dírithe?"

trans-unit.source: They said, "We found our fathers worshippers of them."
trans-unit.target: Dúirt siad, "Fuair muid ár n-aithreacha worshippers acu."

trans-unit.source: He said, "You were certainly, you and your fathers, in manifest error."
trans-unit.target: Dúirt sé, "Bhí tú cinnte, tú féin agus do aithreacha, trí bhotún follasach."

trans-unit.source: They said, "Have you come to us with truth, or are you of those who jest?"
trans-unit.target: Dúirt siad, "An bhfuil a thagann tú chugainn le fírinne, nó má tá tú na daoine a ag magadh?"

trans-unit.source: He said, "[No], rather, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth who created them, and I, to that, am of those who testify.
trans-unit.target: Dúirt sé, "[Níl], in áit, tá do Thiarna an Tiarna na spéartha agus an talamh a chruthaigh iad, agus mé, go dtí sin, am de na daoine a fianaise a thabhairt.

trans-unit.source: And [I swear] by Allah, I will surely plan against your idols after you have turned and gone away."
trans-unit.target: Agus [swear] ag Allah, beidh mé ag pleanáil surely i gcoinne do idols tar éis duit iompaigh agus imithe. "

trans-unit.source: So he made them into fragments, except a large one among them, that they might return to it [and question].
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, rinne sé iad a chur san blúirí, ach amháin ceann mór ina measc, go bhféadfadh siad ar ais dó [agus ceist].

trans-unit.source: They said, "Who has done this to our gods? Indeed, he is of the wrongdoers."
trans-unit.target: Dúirt siad, "Cé atá déanta seo go dtí ár gods? Go deimhin, tá sé ar na agraíodh éagóiritheoirí feadh."

trans-unit.source: They said, "We heard a young man mention them who is called Abraham."
trans-unit.target: Dúirt siad, "Chuala muid fear óg lua iad atá ar a dtugtar Abraham."

trans-unit.source: They said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people that they may testify."
trans-unit.target: Dúirt siad, "Ansin a thabhairt dó roimh na súile na ndaoine gur féidir leo fianaise a thabhairt."

trans-unit.source: They said, "Have you done this to our gods, O Abraham?"
trans-unit.target: Dúirt siad, "An bhfuil tú ag déanamh seo go dtí ár gods, O Abraham?"

trans-unit.source: He said, "Rather, this - the largest of them - did it, so ask them, if they should [be able to] speak."
trans-unit.target: Dúirt sé, "Ina ionad sin, seo - an ceann is mó acu - rinne sé, mar sin iad a iarraidh, má ba chóir iad [in ann] a labhairt."

trans-unit.source: So they returned to [blaming] themselves and said [to each other], "Indeed, you are the wrongdoers."
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, d'fhill siad ar [blaming] féin agus dúirt [lena chéile], "Go deimhin, tá tú ag an agraíodh éagóiritheoirí feadh."

trans-unit.source: Then they reversed themselves, [saying], "You have already known that these do not speak!"
trans-unit.target: Ansin droim ar ais siad iad féin, [ag rá], "Tá tú ar eolas cheana féin nach bhfuil na a labhairt!"

trans-unit.source: He said, "Then do you worship instead of Allah that which does not benefit you at all or harm you?
trans-unit.target: Dúirt sé, "Ansin a dhéanann tú ag adhradh in ionad Allah nach bhfuil tairbhe tú ar chor ar bith, nó dochar a dhéanamh leat?

trans-unit.source: Uff to you and to what you worship instead of Allah. Then will you not use reason?"
trans-unit.target: Uff chun tú, agus leis an méid a adhradh duit in ionad Allah.

trans-unit.source: They said, "Burn him and support your gods - if you are to act."
trans-unit.target: Dúirt siad, "Burn air agus tacaíocht a thabhairt do déithe -. má tá tú a bheith ag gníomhú"

trans-unit.source: Allah said, "O fire, be coolness and safety upon Abraham."
trans-unit.target: Allah dúirt sé, "O tine, a coolness agus sábháilteacht ar Abraham."

trans-unit.source: And they intended for him harm, but We made them the greatest losers.
trans-unit.target: Agus i gceist acu dó díobháil, ach rinne muid iad na losers mó.

trans-unit.source: And We delivered him and Lot to the land which We had blessed for the worlds.
trans-unit.target: Agus a sheachadadh againn air agus Lot leis an talamh a bhí bheannaigh againn do na saol.

trans-unit.source: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob in addition, and all [of them] We made righteous.
trans-unit.target: Agus thug muid dó Isaac agus Jacob ina theannta sin, agus gach [ceann acu] Rinneamar righteous.

trans-unit.source: And We made them leaders guiding by Our command. And We inspired to them the doing of good deeds, establishment of prayer, and giving of zakah; and they were worshippers of Us.
trans-unit.target: Agus rinne muid iad ceannairí a threorú ag ár n-orduithe.

trans-unit.source: And to Lot We gave judgement and knowledge, and We saved him from the city that was committing wicked deeds. Indeed, they were a people of evil, defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: Agus a Lot Thugamar breithiúnas agus eolas, agus a shábháil muid é ó lár na cathrach go raibh cion gníomhais wicked.

trans-unit.source: And We admitted him into Our mercy. Indeed, he was of the righteous.
trans-unit.target: Agus admhaigh muid dó i ár trócaire.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] Noah, when he called [to Allah] before [that time], so We responded to him and saved him and his family from the great flood.
trans-unit.target: Agus [lua] Noah, nuair a chuaigh sé [do Allah] roimh an [an am sin], agus mar sin d'fhreagair muid dó agus a shábháil é féin agus a theaghlach as an tuile mhór.

trans-unit.source: And We saved him from the people who denied Our signs. Indeed, they were a people of evil, so We drowned them, all together.
trans-unit.target: Agus a shábháil muid air ó na daoine a dhiúltú ár comharthaí.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] David and Solomon, when they judged concerning the field - when the sheep of a people overran it [at night], and We were witness to their judgement.
trans-unit.target: Agus [lua] David agus Sholamón, nuair mheas siad a bhaineann leis an réimse - nuair overran na caoirigh le daoine é a [san oíche], agus bhí muid finné a mbreithiúnas.

trans-unit.source: And We gave understanding of the case to Solomon, and to each [of them] We gave judgement and knowledge. And We subjected the mountains to exalt [Us], along with David and [also] the birds. And We were doing [that].
trans-unit.target: Agus thug muid tuiscint ar an cás a Sholamón, agus do gach [ceann acu] Thugamar breithiúnas agus eolas.

trans-unit.source: And We taught him the fashioning of coats of armor to protect you from your [enemy in] battle. So will you then be grateful?
trans-unit.target: Agus mhúin muid dó an Fashioning ar chóta armor chun tú a chosaint ó do [namhaid i] cath.

trans-unit.source: And to Solomon [We subjected] the wind, blowing forcefully, proceeding by his command toward the land which We had blessed. And We are ever, of all things, Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Agus a Solamh [faoi réir muid] an ghaoth, séideadh forcefully, dul ar aghaidh ag a ordú i dtreo an talamh a bhí bheannaigh againn.

trans-unit.source: And of the devils were those who dived for him and did work other than that. And We were of them a guardian.
trans-unit.target: Agus ar an diabhal a bhí na daoine dived dó agus rinne obair seachas sin.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] Job, when he called to his Lord, "Indeed, adversity has touched me, and you are the Most Merciful of the merciful."
trans-unit.target: Agus [lua] Job, nuair a d'iarr sé ar a Thiarna, "Go deimhin, adversity i dteagmháil léi dom, agus go bhfuil tú an chuid is mó trócaire ar an trócaireach."

trans-unit.source: So We responded to him and removed what afflicted him of adversity. And We gave him [back] his family and the like thereof with them as mercy from Us and a reminder for the worshippers [of Allah].
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, d'fhreagair muid leis agus a bhaint an méid a afflicted air na adversity.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] Ishmael and Idrees and Dhul-Kifl; all were of the patient.
trans-unit.target: Agus [lua] Ishmael agus Idrees agus Dhul-Kifl;

trans-unit.source: And We admitted them into Our mercy. Indeed, they were of the righteous.
trans-unit.target: Agus admhaigh muid iad i ár trócaire.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] the man of the fish, when he went off in anger and thought that We would not decree [anything] upon him. And he called out within the darknesses, "There is no deity except You; exalted are You. Indeed, I have been of the wrongdoers."
trans-unit.target: Agus [lua] an fear an t-iasc, nuair a chuaigh sé amach i fearg agus shíl nach mbeadh muid foraithne [rud] air.

trans-unit.source: So We responded to him and saved him from the distress. And thus do We save the believers.
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, d'fhreagair muid dó agus a shábháil air as an anacair.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] Zechariah, when he called to his Lord, "My Lord, do not leave me alone [with no heir], while you are the best of inheritors."
trans-unit.target: Agus [lua] Zechariah, nuair a d'iarr sé ar a Thiarna, "Mo Thiarna, ná saoire dom féin [gan aon oidhre], cé go bhfuil tú an chuid is fearr de na inheritors."

trans-unit.source: So We responded to him, and We gave to him John, and amended for him his wife. Indeed, they used to hasten to good deeds and supplicate Us in hope and fear, and they were to Us humbly submissive.
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, d'fhreagair muid dó, agus thug muid dó John, agus leasaíodh dó a bhean chéile.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] the one who guarded her chastity, so We blew into her [garment] through Our angel [Gabriel], and We made her and her son a sign for the worlds.
trans-unit.target: Agus [lua] an ceann a cosanta h chastity, mar sin shéid muid isteach ina [éadaigh] trí Ár aingeal [Gabriel], agus rinne muid uirthi agus a mac comhartha do na saol.

trans-unit.source: Indeed this, your religion, is one religion, and I am your Lord, so worship Me.
trans-unit.target: Go deimhin seo, tá do reiligiún, creideamh amháin, agus tá mé do Thiarna, agus mar sin adhradh Me.

trans-unit.source: And [yet] they divided their affair among themselves, [but] all to Us will return.
