And We sent down iron, wherein is great military might and benefits for the people, and so that Allah may make evident those who support Him and His messengers unseen. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might.
trans-unit.target: Táimid tar éis a sheoladh cheana féin Ár teachtairí le evidences soiléir agus chuir síos leo an Scrioptúr agus an t-iarmhéid go bhféadfaidh na daoine [a ngnóthaí] chothabháil i ceartais.

trans-unit.source: And We have already sent Noah and Abraham and placed in their descendants prophethood and scripture; and among them is he who is guided, but many of them are defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: Agus muid sheoladh cheana féin Noah agus Abraham agus a chur i n-sliocht Prophethood agus scrioptúr;

trans-unit.source: Then We sent following their footsteps Our messengers and followed [them] with Jesus, the son of Mary, and gave him the Gospel. And We placed in the hearts of those who followed him compassion and mercy and monasticism, which they innovated; We did not prescribe it for them except [that they did so] seeking the approval of Allah. But they did not observe it with due observance. So We gave the ones who believed among them their reward, but many of them are defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: Ansin chuir muid tar éis a n-footsteps Ár teachtairí agus ina dhiaidh sin [iad] le Íosa, an mac Muire, agus thug sé an Soiscéal.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, fear Allah and believe in His Messenger; He will [then] give you a double portion of His mercy and make for you a light by which you will walk and forgive you; and Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: O agat a chreid, eagla Allah agus creidim i a Messenger;

trans-unit.source: [This is] so that the People of the Scripture may know that they are not able [to obtain] anything from the bounty of Allah and that [all] bounty is in the hand of Allah; He gives it to whom He wills. And Allah is the possessor of great bounty.
trans-unit.target: [Tá sé seo] ionas go bhféadfaidh an Phobail na Scripture a fhios nach bhfuil siad in ann [a fháil] rud ar bith as an bounty de Allah agus go bhfuil [fad] deolchaire i láimh Allah;

trans-unit.source: Certainly has Allah heard the speech of the one who argues with you, [O Muhammad], concerning her husband and directs her complaint to Allah. And Allah hears your dialogue; indeed, Allah is Hearing and Seeing.
trans-unit.target: Cinnte tá Allah chuala an óráid an duine a áitíonn a bhfuil tú, [O Muhammad], maidir lena fear céile agus stiúrann sí gearán leis Allah.

trans-unit.source: Those who pronounce thihar among you [to separate] from their wives - they are not [consequently] their mothers. Their mothers are none but those who gave birth to them. And indeed, they are saying an objectionable statement and a falsehood. But indeed, Allah is Pardoning and Forgiving.
trans-unit.target: Iad siúd a breith thihar measc tú [a dheighilt] as a wives - nach bhfuil siad [dá bhrí] lena máithreacha.

trans-unit.source: And those who pronounce thihar from their wives and then [wish to] go back on what they said - then [there must be] the freeing of a slave before they touch one another. That is what you are admonished thereby; and Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
trans-unit.target: Agus iad siúd a breith a thihar as a mná céile agus ansin [ar mian leo dul] dul ar ais ar an méid a dúirt siad - ansin [ní mór go mbeadh] an saoradh daor sula siad teagmháil lena chéile.

trans-unit.source: And he who does not find [a slave] - then a fast for two months consecutively before they touch one another; and he who is unable - then the feeding of sixty poor persons. That is for you to believe [completely] in Allah and His Messenger; and those are the limits [set by] Allah. And for the disbelievers is a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: Agus sé nach bhfuil a aimsiú [daor] - ansin go tapa ar feadh dhá mhí as a chéile sula siad teagmháil chéile;

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who oppose Allah and His Messenger are abased as those before them were abased. And We have certainly sent down verses of clear evidence. And for the disbelievers is a humiliating punishment.
trans-unit.target: Go deimhin, na daoine i gcoinne Allah agus a Messenger a abased mar a bhí abased siúd os a gcomhair.

trans-unit.source: On the Day when Allah will resurrect them all and inform them of what they did. Allah had enumerated it, while they forgot it; and Allah is, over all things, Witness.
trans-unit.target: Ar an Lá nuair a bheidh Allah resurrect iad go léir agus a chur in iúl dóibh cad a rinne siad.

trans-unit.source: Have you not considered that Allah knows what is in the heavens and what is on the earth? There is in no private conversation three but that He is the fourth of them, nor are there five but that He is the sixth of them - and no less than that and no more except that He is with them [in knowledge] wherever they are. Then He will inform them of what they did, on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed Allah is, of all things, Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Bíodh nach tú a mheas go bhfuil a fhios Allah cad é i na Spéartha agus méid atá ar an domhan?

trans-unit.source: Have you not considered those who were forbidden from private conversation, then they return to that which they were forbidden and converse among themselves about sin and aggression and disobedience to the Messenger? And when they come to you, they greet you with that [word] by which Allah does not greet you and say among themselves, "Why does Allah not punish us for what we say?" Sufficient for them is Hell, which they will [enter to] burn, and wretched is the destination.
trans-unit.target: Bíodh nach tú a mheas siúd cosc atá as comhrá príobháideach, ansin filleann siad leis an gceann a raibh siad cosc agus comhrá eatarthu féin faoi sin agus ionsaí agus disobedience chuig an Messenger?

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, when you converse privately, do not converse about sin and aggression and disobedience to the Messenger but converse about righteousness and piety. And fear Allah, to whom you will be gathered.
trans-unit.target: O tú a chreid, nuair converse tú príobháideach, ná comhrá faoi pheaca agus ionsaí agus disobedience chuig an Messenger ach coinbhéarta faoi righteousness agus cráifeacht.

trans-unit.source: Private conversation is only from Satan that he may grieve those who have believed, but he will not harm them at all except by permission of Allah. And upon Allah let the believers rely.
trans-unit.target: Is comhrá príobháideach ach ó Satan go bhféadfaidh sé Grieve dóibh siúd a chreid, ach ní bheidh sé dochar dóibh ar chor ar bith, ach amháin le cead an Allah.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, when you are told, "Space yourselves" in assemblies, then make space; Allah will make space for you. And when you are told, "Arise," then arise; Allah will raise those who have believed among you and those who were given knowledge, by degrees. And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
trans-unit.target: O agat a chreid, nuair a fhaigheann tú scéal, "díbh féin Space" in tionóil, spás a dhéanamh ansin;

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, when you [wish to] privately consult the Messenger, present before your consultation a charity. That is better for you and purer. But if you find not [the means] - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: O tú a chreid, nuair a dhéanann tú [iarraidh] gcomhairle go príobháideach leis an Messenger, i láthair roimh do dul i gcomhairle carthanas.

trans-unit.source: Have you feared to present before your consultation charities? Then when you do not and Allah has forgiven you, then [at least] establish prayer and give zakah and obey Allah and His Messenger. And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
trans-unit.target: An bhfuil eagla tú a chur i láthair roimh do charthanais comhairliúcháin?

trans-unit.source: Have you not considered those who make allies of a people with whom Allah has become angry? They are neither of you nor of them, and they swear to untruth while they know [they are lying].
trans-unit.target: Bíodh nach tú a mheas dóibh siúd a dhéanann allies de dhaoine lena bhfuil Allah éis éirí feargach?

trans-unit.source: Allah has prepared for them a severe punishment. Indeed, it was evil that they were doing.
trans-unit.target: Allah ullmhaithe dóibh pionós dian.

trans-unit.source: They took their [false] oaths as a cover, so they averted [people] from the way of Allah, and for them is a humiliating punishment.
trans-unit.target: Thóg siad a gcuid [bréagach] mhionn mar chlúdach, mar sin seachnaíodh siad [daoine] ó an mbealach Allah, agus dóibh go bhfuil pionós humiliating.

trans-unit.source: Never will their wealth or their children avail them against Allah at all. Those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally
trans-unit.target: Ní bheidh a saibhreas nó a gcuid leanaí leas bhaint gcoinne Allah ar chor ar bith.

trans-unit.source: On the Day Allah will resurrect them all, and they will swear to Him as they swear to you and think that they are [standing] on something. Unquestionably, it is they who are the liars.
trans-unit.target: Ar an Lá Beidh Allah resurrect iad go léir, agus beidh siad swear chun Eisean mar swear siad leat agus smaoineamh go bhfuil siad [seasamh] ar rud éigin.

trans-unit.source: Satan has overcome them and made them forget the remembrance of Allah. Those are the party of Satan. Unquestionably, the party of Satan - they will be the losers.
trans-unit.target: Satan Tá shárú agus rinneadh iad dearmad ar an gcuimhne ar Allah.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the ones who oppose Allah and His Messenger - those will be among the most humbled.
trans-unit.target: Go deimhin, na cinn a chuireann i gcoinne Allah agus a Messenger - beidh na i measc an chuid is mó humbled.

trans-unit.source: Allah has written, "I will surely overcome, I and My messengers." Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might.
trans-unit.target: Allah ag scríobh, "beidh mé a shárú surely, I agus Mo messengers."

trans-unit.source: You will not find a people who believe in Allah and the Last Day having affection for those who oppose Allah and His Messenger, even if they were their fathers or their sons or their brothers or their kindred. Those - He has decreed within their hearts faith and supported them with spirit from Him. And We will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. Allah is pleased with them, and they are pleased with Him - those are the party of Allah. Unquestionably, the party of Allah - they are the successful.
trans-unit.target: Ní bheidh tú teacht ar na daoine a chreideann i Allah agus an lá is déanaí a bhfuil gean do na daoine i gcoinne Allah agus a Messenger, fiú amháin má bhí siad a n-aithreacha ná a mic nó a n-deartháireacha nó a n-tsamhail chéanna.

trans-unit.source: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth exalts Allah, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Cibé rud a bhfuil sna flaithis agus is cuma cad é ar an domhain exalts Allah, agus tá sé an exalted sa fhéadfadh, an Wise.

trans-unit.source: It is He who expelled the ones who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture from their homes at the first gathering. You did not think they would leave, and they thought that their fortresses would protect them from Allah; but [the decree of] Allah came upon them from where they had not expected, and He cast terror into their hearts [so] they destroyed their houses by their [own] hands and the hands of the believers. So take warning, O people of vision.
trans-unit.target: Is té a dhíbirt na cinn a disbelieved measc an Phobail na Scripture óna dtithe ag an chéad teacht le chéile.

trans-unit.source: And if not that Allah had decreed for them evacuation, He would have punished them in [this] world, and for them in the Hereafter is the punishment of the Fire.
trans-unit.target: Agus más rud é nach go raibh decreed Allah dóibh aslonnú, Bheadh sé ag phionósú dóibh i [seo] ar domhan, agus dóibh sa dhiaidh é an pionós an Dóiteáin.

trans-unit.source: That is because they opposed Allah and His Messenger. And whoever opposes Allah - then indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.
trans-unit.target: Is é sin mar raibh siad i gcoinne Allah agus a Messenger.

trans-unit.source: Whatever you have cut down of [their] palm trees or left standing on their trunks - it was by permission of Allah and so He would disgrace the defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: Cibé rud a tú ghearradh síos ar [a] crainn pailme nó a fhágáil ina seasamh ar a n-trunks - bhí sé le cead Allah agus mar sin bheadh sé a disgrace an disobedient defiantly.

trans-unit.source: And what Allah restored [of property] to His Messenger from them - you did not spur for it [in an expedition] any horses or camels, but Allah gives His messengers power over whom He wills, and Allah is over all things competent.
trans-unit.target: Agus cad Allah ais [maoine] chuig a Messenger uathu - nach raibh tú spor chun é [i expedition] aon capaill nó camels, ach tugann Allah a teachtairí cumhacht níos mó a bhfuil sé uachtanna, agus Allah thar gach rud inniúil.

trans-unit.source: And what Allah restored to His Messenger from the people of the towns - it is for Allah and for the Messenger and for [his] near relatives and orphans and the [stranded] traveler - so that it will not be a perpetual distribution among the rich from among you. And whatever the Messenger has given you - take; and what he has forbidden you - refrain from. And fear Allah; indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.
trans-unit.target: Agus cad ais Allah chun a chuid Messenger ó mhuintir na mbailte - tá sé do Allah agus don Messenger agus as [a] in aice ghaolta agus dílleachtaí agus [stranded] taistealaí - ionas nach mbeidh sé dáileadh suthain i measc na saibhir

trans-unit.source: For the poor emigrants who were expelled from their homes and their properties, seeking bounty from Allah and [His] approval and supporting Allah and His Messenger, [there is also a share]. Those are the truthful.
trans-unit.target: Maidir leis heisimircigh bochta a bhí dhíbirt as a gcuid tithe agus a n-airíonna, ag lorg deolchaire ó Allah agus [a] ceadú agus tacú Allah agus a Messenger, [tá freisin sciar].

trans-unit.source: And [also for] those who were settled in al-Madinah and [adopted] the faith before them. They love those who emigrated to them and find not any want in their breasts of what the emigrants were given but give [them] preference over themselves, even though they are in privation. And whoever is protected from the stinginess of his soul - it is those who will be the successful.
trans-unit.target: Agus [chomh maith le haghaidh] dóibh siúd Socraíodh cé sa al-Madinah agus [ghlac] an creideamh os a gcomhair.

trans-unit.source: And [there is a share for] those who came after them, saying, "Our Lord, forgive us and our brothers who preceded us in faith and put not in our hearts [any] resentment toward those who have believed. Our Lord, indeed You are Kind and Merciful."
trans-unit.target: Agus [tá sciar do] dóibh siúd a tháinig ina ndiaidh, ag rá, "Ár dTiarna, maith dúinn agus ár deartháireacha a roimh dúinn mheon agus ní inár gcroí [aon] fala dtreo siúd a chreid. Ár dTiarna, go deimhin

trans-unit.source: Have you not considered those who practice hypocrisy, saying to their brothers who have disbelieved among the People of the Scripture, "If you are expelled, we will surely leave with you, and we will not obey, in regard to you, anyone - ever; and if you are fought, we will surely aid you." But Allah testifies that they are liars.
trans-unit.target: Bíodh nach tú a mheas na cleachtais hypocrisy, ag rá a n-deartháireacha a disbelieved measc an Phobail na Scripture, "Má tá tú a dhíbirt, beidh muid a fhágáil surely le tú, agus ní bheidh muid obey, maidir leis duit, aon duine - riamh

trans-unit.source: If they are expelled, they will not leave with them, and if they are fought, they will not aid them. And [even] if they should aid them, they will surely turn their backs; then [thereafter] they will not be aided.
trans-unit.target: Má tá siad dhíbirt, ní bheidh siad a fhágáil leo, agus má tá siad throid, ní bheidh siad cabhrú leo.

trans-unit.source: You [believers] are more fearful within their breasts than Allah. That is because they are a people who do not understand.
trans-unit.target: Tá tú [believers] Tá níos fearful laistigh dá breasts seachas Allah.

trans-unit.source: They will not fight you all except within fortified cities or from behind walls. Their violence among themselves is severe. You think they are together, but their hearts are diverse. That is because they are a people who do not reason.
trans-unit.target: Ní bheidh siad ag troid leat go léir ach amháin laistigh de na cathracha daingne nó ó taobh thiar de bhallaí.

trans-unit.source: [Theirs is] like the example of those shortly before them: they tasted the bad consequence of their affair, and they will have a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: [Is inniúlacht siúd] cosúil leis an sampla de sin go gairid roimh iad: tasted siad an iarmhairt droch gcuid affair, agus beidh siad ag pionós painful.

trans-unit.source: [The hypocrites are] like the example of Satan when he says to man, "Disbelieve." But when he disbelieves, he says, "Indeed, I am disassociated from you. Indeed, I fear Allah, Lord of the worlds."
trans-unit.target: [Is iad na hypocrites] cosúil leis an sampla de Satan nuair a deir sé go fear, "disbelieve."

trans-unit.source: So the outcome for both of them is that they will be in the Fire, abiding eternally therein. And that is the recompense of the wrong-doers.
trans-unit.target: Dá bhrí sin tá an toradh le haghaidh an mbeirt acu go mbeidh siad sa Dóiteáin, géilliúil eternally ann.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, fear Allah. And let every soul look to what it has put forth for tomorrow - and fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
trans-unit.target: O agat a chreid, eagla Allah.

trans-unit.source: And be not like those who forgot Allah, so He made them forget themselves. Those are the defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: Agus a bheith Ní maith liom iad siúd a dearmad Allah, mar sin rinne sé dóibh dearmad féin.

trans-unit.source: Not equal are the companions of the Fire and the companions of Paradise. The companions of Paradise - they are the attainers [of success].
trans-unit.target: Gan cothrom an compánach an Dóiteáin agus an companions de Paradise.

trans-unit.source: If We had sent down this Qur'an upon a mountain, you would have seen it humbled and coming apart from fear of Allah. And these examples We present to the people that perhaps they will give thought.
trans-unit.target: Dá mbeadh chuir muid síos an Qur'an ar sliabh, ba mhaith leat a bheith le feiceáil humbled é agus teacht amach ó eagla Allah.

trans-unit.source: He is Allah, other than whom there is no deity, Knower of the unseen and the witnessed. He is the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Tá sé Allah, ach amháin, ná fuil aon deity, Knower an unseen agus fianaithe.

trans-unit.source: He is Allah, other than whom there is no deity, the Sovereign, the Pure, the Perfection, the Bestower of Faith, the Overseer, the Exalted in Might, the Compeller, the Superior. Exalted is Allah above whatever they associate with Him.
trans-unit.target: Tá sé Allah, ach amháin, ná fuil aon deity, an Fhlaitheasacha, an Pure, an foirfeacht, an Bestower an Chreidimh, an Feitheoir, an exalted sa fhéadfadh, an Compeller, an Superior.

trans-unit.source: He is Allah, the Creator, the Inventor, the Fashioner; to Him belong the best names. Whatever is in the heavens and earth is exalting Him. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Tá sé Allah, an Cruthaitheoir, an Aireagóir, an Fashioner;

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not take My enemies and your enemies as allies, extending to them affection while they have disbelieved in what came to you of the truth, having driven out the Prophet and yourselves [only] because you believe in Allah, your Lord. If you have come out for jihad in My cause and seeking means to My approval, [take them not as friends]. You confide to them affection, but I am most knowing of what you have concealed and what you have declared. And whoever does it among you has certainly strayed from the soundness of the way.
trans-unit.target: O agat a chreid, ná a ghlacadh mo naimhde agus do naimhde mar allies, a leathnú chun iad gean agus tá siad disbelieved in cad a tháinig chugat na fírinne, tar éis thiomáint amach an Prophet agus díbh féin [amháin] toisc go gcreideann tú i Allah,

trans-unit.source: If they gain dominance over you, they would be to you as enemies and extend against you their hands and their tongues with evil, and they wish you would disbelieve.
trans-unit.target: Má fhaigheann siad ceannas thar tú, bheadh siad a thabhairt duit mar naimhde agus a leathnú i gcoinne tú a lámha agus a theanga le olc, agus is mian leo go mbeadh tú disbelieve.

trans-unit.source: Never will your relatives or your children benefit you; the Day of Resurrection He will judge between you. And Allah, of what you do, is Seeing.
trans-unit.target: Beidh do ghaolta nó do leanaí tairbhe riamh agat;

trans-unit.source: There has already been for you an excellent pattern in Abraham and those with him, when they said to their people, "Indeed, we are disassociated from you and from whatever you worship other than Allah. We have denied you, and there has appeared between us and you animosity and hatred forever until you believe in Allah alone" except for the saying of Abraham to his father, "I will surely ask forgiveness for you, but I have not [power to do] for you anything against Allah. Our Lord, upon You we have relied, and to You we have returned, and to You is the destination.
trans-unit.target: Tharla cheana féin le haghaidh tú patrún iontach i Abraham agus iad siúd leis, nuair a dúirt siad a n-daoine, "Go deimhin, tá muid ag disassociated ó tú, agus ó cibé adhradh tú seachas Allah. Táimid tar éis diúltaíodh tú, agus tá an chuma idir

trans-unit.source: Our Lord, make us not [objects of] torment for the disbelievers and forgive us, our Lord. Indeed, it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise."
trans-unit.target: Ár dTiarna, a dhéanamh linn nach bhfuil [cuspóirí] crá do na disbelievers agus maith dúinn, ár dTiarna.

trans-unit.source: There has certainly been for you in them an excellent pattern for anyone whose hope is in Allah and the Last Day. And whoever turns away - then indeed, Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.
trans-unit.target: Tháinig cinnte ar do shon iontu patrún iontach do dhuine ar bith a bhfuil a dóchas i Allah agus an lá is déanaí.

trans-unit.source: Perhaps Allah will put, between you and those to whom you have been enemies among them, affection. And Allah is competent, and Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: B'fhéidir go mbeidh Allah chur, idir tú féin agus iad siúd a bhfuil a bhí tú naimhde ina measc, gean.

trans-unit.source: Allah does not forbid you from those who do not fight you because of religion and do not expel you from your homes - from being righteous toward them and acting justly toward them. Indeed, Allah loves those who act justly.
trans-unit.target: Ní Allah forbid tú ó iad siúd nach bhfuil ag troid tú mar gheall ar an reiligiún agus ní gá dhíbirt tú ó do thithe - ó bheith righteous i dtreo orthu agus ag gníomhú justly i dtreo iad.

trans-unit.source: Allah only forbids you from those who fight you because of religion and expel you from your homes and aid in your expulsion - [forbids] that you make allies of them. And whoever makes allies of them, then it is those who are the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: Allah cosc ach tú ó na daoine a throid tú mar gheall ar an reiligiún agus dhíbirt tú ó do thithe agus cúnamh i do díbirt - [cosc] a dhéanann tú allies acu.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, when the believing women come to you as emigrants, examine them. Allah is most knowing as to their faith. And if you know them to be believers, then do not return them to the disbelievers; they are not lawful [wives] for them, nor are they lawful [husbands] for them. But give the disbelievers what they have spent. And there is no blame upon you if you marry them when you have given them their due compensation. And hold not to marriage bonds with disbelieving women, but ask for what you have spent and let them ask for what they have spent. That is the judgement of Allah; He judges between you. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: O tú a chreid, nuair a thagann na mná a chreidiúint a thabhairt duit mar eisimircigh, iad a scrúdú.

trans-unit.source: And if you have lost any of your wives to the disbelievers and you subsequently obtain [something], then give those whose wives have gone the equivalent of what they had spent. And fear Allah, in whom you are believers.
trans-unit.target: Agus má tá tú caillte ar bith de do chuid mná céile leis an disbelievers agus a fháil tú ina dhiaidh sin [rud], a thabhairt ansin iad siúd a bhfuil mná céile go bhfuil siad imithe comhionann méid a bhí a chaith siad.

trans-unit.source: O Prophet, when the believing women come to you pledging to you that they will not associate anything with Allah, nor will they steal, nor will they commit unlawful sexual intercourse, nor will they kill their children, nor will they bring forth a slander they have invented between their arms and legs, nor will they disobey you in what is right - then accept their pledge and ask forgiveness for them of Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: O Prophet, nuair a thagann na mná a chreidiúint le pledging duit a thabhairt duit nach mbeidh siad rud ar bith le Allah chomhlachú, ná ní bheidh siad steal, ná ní bheidh siad tiomanta caidreamh collaí neamhdhleathach, ná ní bheidh siad a mharú a gcuid páistí, ná beidh siad a thabhairt amach a clúmhilleadh siad

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not make allies of a people with whom Allah has become angry. They have despaired of [reward in] the Hereafter just as the disbelievers have despaired of [meeting] the inhabitants of the graves.
trans-unit.target: O agat a chreid, ní gá allies de dhaoine lena bhfuil Allah bheith feargach dhéanamh.

trans-unit.source: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth exalts Allah, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Cibé rud a bhfuil sna flaithis agus is cuma cad é ar an domhain exalts Allah, agus tá sé an exalted sa fhéadfadh, an Wise.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, why do you say what you do not do?
trans-unit.target: O agat a chreid, cén fáth a bhfuil tú ag rá cad é nach bhfuil tú a dhéanamh?

trans-unit.source: Great is hatred in the sight of Allah that you say what you do not do.
trans-unit.target: Great fuath i radharc na Allah a deir tú cad nach bhfuil tú a dhéanamh.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Allah loves those who fight in His cause in a row as though they are a [single] structure joined firmly.
trans-unit.target: Go deimhin, Is breá Allah siúd a throid in a chúis as a chéile mar cé go bhfuil siad [singil] Struchtúr isteach go daingean.

trans-unit.source: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Moses said to his people, "O my people, why do you harm me while you certainly know that I am the messenger of Allah to you?" And when they deviated, Allah caused their hearts to deviate. And Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.
trans-unit.target: Agus [lua, O Muhammad], nuair a dúirt Moses a chuid daoine, "O mo mhuintir, cén fáth a bhfuil tú dochar dom agus tá a fhios agat cinnte go bhfuil mé an teachtaire de Allah a thabhairt duit?"

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when Jesus, the son of Mary, said, "O children of Israel, indeed I am the messenger of Allah to you confirming what came before me of the Torah and bringing good tidings of a messenger to come after me, whose name is Ahmad." But when he came to them with clear evidences, they said, "This is obvious magic."
trans-unit.target: Agus [lua] nuair Íosa, an mac Muire, dúirt sé, "páistí O Iosrael, go deimhin, tá mé an teachtaire de Allah a thabhairt duit deimhniú a tháinig os mo chomhair an Torah agus a thabhairt tidings maith teachtaire atá le teacht i mo dhiaidh, a bhfuil a

trans-unit.source: And who is more unjust than one who invents about Allah untruth while he is being invited to Islam. And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
trans-unit.target: Agus is é níos éagórach mó ná aon a invents faoi Allah untruth fad a bheidh sé á cuireadh do Ioslam.

trans-unit.source: They want to extinguish the light of Allah with their mouths, but Allah will perfect His light, although the disbelievers dislike it.
trans-unit.target: Tá siad ag iarraidh a mhúchadh an solas na Allah lena n-mouths, ach beidh Allah foirfe a solais, cé go bhfuil an disbelievers nach dtaitníonn sé.

trans-unit.source: It is He who sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth to manifest it over all religion, although those who associate others with Allah dislike it.
trans-unit.target: Is té chuir a Messenger le treoir agus an reiligiún na fírinne a léiriú sé os cionn gach reiligiún, cé na daoine a chomhlachú daoine eile a bhfuil Allah nach dtaitníonn sé.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, shall I guide you to a transaction that will save you from a painful punishment?
trans-unit.target: O agat a chreid, beidh mé tú a threorú le hidirbheart a shábháil tú ó phionós painful?

trans-unit.source: [It is that] you believe in Allah and His Messenger and strive in the cause of Allah with your wealth and your lives. That is best for you, if you should know.
trans-unit.target: [Is go] chreideann tú i Allah agus a Messenger, agus déanfaimid iarracht i an chúis Allah le do saibhreas agus do shaol.

trans-unit.source: He will forgive for you your sins and admit you to gardens beneath which rivers flow and pleasant dwellings in gardens of perpetual residence. That is the great attainment.
trans-unit.target: Beidh sé logh duit féin do chuid peacaí agus tú a ligean isteach go dtí gairdíní faoi bhun a aibhneacha sreabhadh agus áitribh taitneamhach i ngairdíní cónaithe suthain.

trans-unit.source: And [you will obtain] another [favor] that you love - victory from Allah and an imminent conquest; and give good tidings to the believers.
trans-unit.target: Agus [beidh tú a fháil] eile [bhfabhar] go bhfuil grá agat - bua ó Allah agus conquest tí tarlú;

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, be supporters of Allah, as when Jesus, the son of Mary, said to the disciples, "Who are my supporters for Allah?" The disciples said, "We are supporters of Allah." And a faction of the Children of Israel believed and a faction disbelieved. So We supported those who believed against their enemy, and they became dominant.
trans-unit.target: O agat a chreid, a lucht tacaíochta na Allah, mar nuair a dúirt Íosa, an mac Muire, do na deisceabail, "Cé go bhfuil mo lucht tacaíochta do Allah?"

trans-unit.source: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth is exalting Allah, the Sovereign, the Pure, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Cibé rud a bhfuil sna flaithis agus is cuma cad é ar an domhan atá exalting Allah, an Fhlaitheasacha, an Pure, an exalted sa fhéadfadh, an Wise.

trans-unit.source: It is He who has sent among the unlettered a Messenger from themselves reciting to them His verses and purifying them and teaching them the Book and wisdom - although they were before in clear error -
trans-unit.target: Is té Tá sheoladh i measc na unlettered a Messenger ó iad féin ag aithris dóibh a chuid véarsaí agus purifying leo agus a mhúineadh dóibh an Leabhar agus ghaois - cé go raibh siad roimh bhotún soiléir -

trans-unit.source: And [to] others of them who have not yet joined them. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Agus [a] do dhaoine eile de a bheidh tar éis nár chuaigh go fóill iad.

trans-unit.source: That is the bounty of Allah, which He gives to whom He wills, and Allah is the possessor of great bounty.
trans-unit.target: Is é sin an bounty de Allah, a thugann sé dá uachtanna, agus is é Allah an sealbhóir bounty mór.

trans-unit.source: The example of those who were entrusted with the Torah and then did not take it on is like that of a donkey who carries volumes [of books]. Wretched is the example of the people who deny the signs of Allah. And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
trans-unit.target: Is é an sampla na ndaoine a bhí de chúram orthu siúd leis an Torah agus ansin ní raibh a ghlacadh ar mar sin de asal a sheolann imleabhar [leabhar].

trans-unit.source: Say, "O you who are Jews, if you claim that you are allies of Allah, excluding the [other] people, then wish for death, if you should be truthful."
trans-unit.target: Abair, "O tú atá Giúdaigh, má dhéantar éileamh go bhfuil tú allies de Allah, gan an [eile] daoine, ansin is mian i leith báis, má ba chóir duit a bheith fírinneach."

trans-unit.source: But they will not wish for it, ever, because of what their hands have put forth. And Allah is Knowing of the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: Ach ní bheidh siad ag iarraidh chun é, riamh, mar gheall ar an méid atá a lámha a chur amach.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Indeed, the death from which you flee - indeed, it will meet you. Then you will be returned to the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, and He will inform you about what you used to do."
trans-unit.target: Abair, "Go deimhin, an bás óna bhfaigheann tú teitheadh - go deimhin, beidh sé bualadh leat Ansin, beidh tú a chur ar ais chuig an Knower an unseen agus chonaic, agus beidh sé in iúl duit faoi na rudaí a d'úsáid tú a dhéanamh.."

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, when [the adhan] is called for the prayer on the day of Jumu'ah [Friday], then proceed to the remembrance of Allah and leave trade. That is better for you, if you only knew.
trans-unit.target: O agat a chreid, nuair [an Adhan] dtugtar an paidir ar an lá de Jumu'ah [Dé hAoine], ansin dul ar aghaidh go dtí an gcuimhne ar Allah agus saoire trádála.

trans-unit.source: And when the prayer has been concluded, disperse within the land and seek from the bounty of Allah, and remember Allah often that you may succeed.
trans-unit.target: Agus nuair a bheidh an paidir curtha i gcrích, a scaipeadh laistigh den talamh agus a lorg ó na deolchaire Allah, agus cuimhnigh Allah minic gur féidir leat éireoidh.

trans-unit.source: But when they saw a transaction or a diversion, [O Muhammad], they rushed to it and left you standing. Say, "What is with Allah is better than diversion and than a transaction, and Allah is the best of providers."
trans-unit.target: Ach nuair a chonaic siad idirbheart nó atreorú, [O Muhammad], Theith siad leis é agus d'fhág tú ag seasamh.

trans-unit.source: When the hypocrites come to you, [O Muhammad], they say, "We testify that you are the Messenger of Allah." And Allah knows that you are His Messenger, and Allah testifies that the hypocrites are liars.
trans-unit.target: Nuair a thagann na hypocrites a thabhairt duit, [O Muhammad], a deir siad, "fianaise a thabhairt go bhfuil tú ar an Messenger de Allah."

trans-unit.source: They have taken their oaths as a cover, so they averted [people] from the way of Allah. Indeed, it was evil that they were doing.
trans-unit.target: Tá siad tar éis a n-mhionn mar chlúdach, mar sin seachnaíodh siad [daoine] ó bhealach ar Allah.

trans-unit.source: That is because they believed, and then they disbelieved; so their hearts were sealed over, and they do not understand.
trans-unit.target: Is é sin mar gur chreid siad, agus ansin disbelieved siad;

trans-unit.source: And when you see them, their forms please you, and if they speak, you listen to their speech. [They are] as if they were pieces of wood propped up - they think that every shout is against them. They are the enemy, so beware of them. May Allah destroy them; how are they deluded?
trans-unit.target: Agus nuair a fheiceann tú iad, a gcuid foirmeacha thoil agat, agus má labhraíonn siad, éisteann tú gcuid cainte.

trans-unit.source: And when it is said to them, "Come, the Messenger of Allah will ask forgiveness for you," they turn their heads aside and you see them evading while they are arrogant.
trans-unit.target: Agus nuair a bheidh sé dúirt sé leo: "Tar, an Messenger de Allah a iarraidh maithiúnas do shon," téann siad a gceann ar ceal agus a fheiceann tú iad evading fad is atá siad sotalach.

trans-unit.source: It is all the same for them whether you ask forgiveness for them or do not ask forgiveness for them; never will Allah forgive them. Indeed, Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.
trans-unit.target: Tá sé ar fad mar an gcéanna as nó aisti iarrann tú maithiúnas dóibh nó nach ceist maithiúnas dóibh;

trans-unit.source: They are the ones who say, "Do not spend on those who are with the Messenger of Allah until they disband." And to Allah belongs the depositories of the heavens and the earth, but the hypocrites do not understand.
trans-unit.target: Is iad na cinn a rá, "Ná chaitheamh ar iad siúd atá leis an Messenger de Allah go disband siad."

trans-unit.source: They say, "If we return to al-Madinah, the more honored [for power] will surely expel therefrom the more humble." And to Allah belongs [all] honor, and to His Messenger, and to the believers, but the hypocrites do not know.
trans-unit.target: Deir siad, "Má táimid ag filleadh al-Madinah, is mó onóir [do chumhacht] a dhíbirt surely aisti an níos humble."

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, let not your wealth and your children divert you from remembrance of Allah. And whoever does that - then those are the losers.
trans-unit.target: O agat a chreid, lig do saibhreas agus do leanaí a atreorú tú ó gcuimhne ar Allah.

trans-unit.source: And spend [in the way of Allah] from what We have provided you before death approaches one of you and he says, "My Lord, if only You would delay me for a brief term so I would give charity and be among the righteous."
trans-unit.target: Agus caitheann [sa bhealach ar Allah] ón méid atá againn ar fáil duit sula chuige bás ar cheann de tú, agus deir sé, "Mo Thiarna, más rud é amháin go mbeadh tú a moill orm ar feadh téarma gearr sin ba mhaith liom a thabhairt carthanas agus a bheith i measc na righteous.

trans-unit.source: But never will Allah delay a soul when its time has come. And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
trans-unit.target: Ach ní bheidh Allah moill Soul nuair a chuid ama teacht.

trans-unit.source: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth is exalting Allah. To Him belongs dominion, and to Him belongs [all] praise, and He is over all things competent.
trans-unit.target: Cibé rud a bhfuil sna flaithis agus is cuma cad é ar an domhan atá exalting Allah.

trans-unit.source: It is He who created you, and among you is the disbeliever, and among you is the believer. And Allah, of what you do, is Seeing.
trans-unit.target: Is té a chruthaigh tú, agus i measc tú go bhfuil an disbeliever, agus i measc tú go bhfuil an believer.

trans-unit.source: He created the heavens and earth in truth and formed you and perfected your forms; and to Him is the [final] destination.
trans-unit.target: Chruthaigh sé na flaithis agus talamh i bhfírinne agus déanta agat agus perfected do fhoirmeacha;

trans-unit.source: He knows what is within the heavens and earth and knows what you conceal and what you declare. And Allah is Knowing of that within the breasts.
trans-unit.target: Tá a fhios aige cad é laistigh de na flaithis agus talamh agus a fhios cad cheilt tú, agus cad a dhearbhú.

trans-unit.source: Has there not come to you the news of those who disbelieved before? So they tasted the bad consequence of their affair, and they will have a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: Tá ann nach bhfuil teacht ar tú an nuacht na ndaoine a disbelieved roimhe seo?

trans-unit.source: That is because their messengers used to come to them with clear evidences, but they said, "Shall human beings guide us?" and disbelieved and turned away. And Allah dispensed [with them]; and Allah is Free of need and Praiseworthy.
trans-unit.target: Is é sin mar a teachtairí úsáidtear chun teacht chucu le evidences soiléir, ach dúirt siad, "Déanfar dhaoine treoir a thabhairt dúinn?"

trans-unit.source: Those who disbelieve have claimed that they will never be resurrected. Say, "Yes, by my Lord, you will surely be resurrected; then you will surely be informed of what you did. And that, for Allah, is easy."
trans-unit.target: Iad siúd a disbelieve mhaígh go ní bheidh siad a resurrected.

trans-unit.source: So believe in Allah and His Messenger and the Qur'an which We have sent down. And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, creidim i Allah agus a Messenger, agus an Qur'an atá againn a sheoladh síos.

trans-unit.source: The Day He will assemble you for the Day of Assembly - that is the Day of Deprivation. And whoever believes in Allah and does righteousness - He will remove from him his misdeeds and admit him to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever. That is the great attainment.
trans-unit.target: An Lá Beidh sé assemble tú chun Lá na Tionóil - is é sin an Lá na Díothachta.

trans-unit.source: But the ones who disbelieved and denied Our verses - those are the companions of the Fire, abiding eternally therein; and wretched is the destination.
trans-unit.target: Ach na cinn a disbelieved agus shéan Ár véarsaí - iad siúd na compánaigh an Dóiteáin, géilliúil eternally ann;

trans-unit.source: No disaster strikes except by permission of Allah. And whoever believes in Allah - He will guide his heart. And Allah is Knowing of all things.
trans-unit.target: Níl stailceanna tubaiste ach amháin le cead Allah.

trans-unit.source: And obey Allah and obey the Messenger; but if you turn away - then upon Our Messenger is only [the duty of] clear notification.
trans-unit.target: Agus obey Allah agus obey an Messenger;

trans-unit.source: Allah - there is no deity except Him. And upon Allah let the believers rely.
trans-unit.target: Allah - níl aon deity ach amháin Eisean.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, indeed, among your wives and your children are enemies to you, so beware of them. But if you pardon and overlook and forgive - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: O agat a chreid, go deimhin, i measc do mná céile agus do leanaí naimhde a thabhairt duit, mar sin beware acu.

trans-unit.source: Your wealth and your children are but a trial, and Allah has with Him a great reward.
trans-unit.target: Do saibhreas agus do leanaí atá ach triail, agus Allah tá le Eisean ar luaíocht mór.

trans-unit.source: So fear Allah as much as you are able and listen and obey and spend [in the way of Allah]; it is better for your selves. And whoever is protected from the stinginess of his soul - it is those who will be the successful.
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, eagla Allah an oiread agus is go bhfuil tú in ann agus éisteacht agus a obey agus a chaitheamh [sa bhealach ar Allah];

trans-unit.source: If you loan Allah a goodly loan, He will multiply it for you and forgive you. And Allah is Most Appreciative and Forbearing.
trans-unit.target: Má iasacht tú Allah iasacht goodly, beidh sé ag iolrú ar do shon agus maith agat.

trans-unit.source: Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Knower an unseen agus chonaic, an exalted sa fhéadfadh, an Wise.

trans-unit.source: O Prophet, when you [Muslims] divorce women, divorce them for [the commencement of] their waiting period and keep count of the waiting period, and fear Allah, your Lord. Do not turn them out of their [husbands'] houses, nor should they [themselves] leave [during that period] unless they are committing a clear immorality. And those are the limits [set by] Allah. And whoever transgresses the limits of Allah has certainly wronged himself. You know not; perhaps Allah will bring about after that a [different] matter.
trans-unit.target: O Prophet, nuair a dhéanann tú [Muslims] mná colscartha, colscaradh leo as [thosach] a dtréimhse feithimh agus comhaireamh na tréimhse feithimh a choinneáil, agus eagla Allah, do Tiarna.

trans-unit.source: And when they have [nearly] fulfilled their term, either retain them according to acceptable terms or part with them according to acceptable terms. And bring to witness two just men from among you and establish the testimony for [the acceptance of] Allah. That is instructed to whoever should believe in Allah and the Last day. And whoever fears Allah - He will make for him a way out
trans-unit.target: Agus nuair a bhí siad [beagnach] chomhlíon siad fhadtéarmach a áirithiú, iad a choinneáil i gcomhréir le téarmaí inghlactha nó cuid leo de réir théarmaí inghlactha.

trans-unit.source: And will provide for him from where he does not expect. And whoever relies upon Allah - then He is sufficient for him. Indeed, Allah will accomplish His purpose. Allah has already set for everything a [decreed] extent.
trans-unit.target: Agus soláthróidh sé dó ó áit nach bhfuil sé ag súil.

trans-unit.source: And those who no longer expect menstruation among your women - if you doubt, then their period is three months, and [also for] those who have not menstruated. And for those who are pregnant, their term is until they give birth. And whoever fears Allah - He will make for him of his matter ease.
trans-unit.target: Agus iad siúd a thuilleadh a bheith ag súil menstruation i measc do na mban - má tá amhras ort, ansin tá a n-tréimhse trí mhí, agus [chomh maith] dóibh siúd nach bhfuil menstruated.

trans-unit.source: That is the command of Allah, which He has sent down to you; and whoever fears Allah - He will remove for him his misdeeds and make great for him his reward.
trans-unit.target: Is é sin an t-ordú de Allah, a bhfuil sé a sheoladh síos a thabhairt duit;

trans-unit.source: Lodge them [in a section] of where you dwell out of your means and do not harm them in order to oppress them. And if they should be pregnant, then spend on them until they give birth. And if they breastfeed for you, then give them their payment and confer among yourselves in the acceptable way; but if you are in discord, then there may breastfeed for the father another woman.
trans-unit.target: Thaisceadh iad [i roinn] d'áit dwell tú as d'acmhainn agus nach iad a dochar chun oppress orthu.

trans-unit.source: Let a man of wealth spend from his wealth, and he whose provision is restricted - let him spend from what Allah has given him. Allah does not charge a soul except [according to] what He has given it. Allah will bring about, after hardship, ease.
trans-unit.target: Lig fear de chaiteachas saibhreas as a chuid saibhris, agus é a mbainfeadh a soláthar teoranta - a ligean dó a chaitheamh as an méid atá Allah thug dó.

trans-unit.source: And how many a city was insolent toward the command of its Lord and His messengers, so We took it to severe account and punished it with a terrible punishment.
trans-unit.target: Agus cé mhéad a bhí insolent chathair i dtreo an gceannas ar a Tiarna agus a teachtairí, agus mar sin ghlac muid é le cuntas mór agus é a phionósú le pionós uafásach.

trans-unit.source: And it tasted the bad consequence of its affair, and the outcome of its affair was loss.
trans-unit.target: Agus tasted sé an iarmhairt olc a affair, agus ba é an toradh a affair caillteanais.

trans-unit.source: Allah has prepared for them a severe punishment; so fear Allah, O you of understanding who have believed. Allah has sent down to you the Qur'an.
trans-unit.target: Allah ullmhaithe dóibh pionós dian;

trans-unit.source: [He sent] a Messenger [Muhammad] reciting to you the distinct verses of Allah that He may bring out those who believe and do righteous deeds from darknesses into the light. And whoever believes in Allah and does righteousness - He will admit him into gardens beneath which rivers flow to abide therein forever. Allah will have perfected for him a provision.
trans-unit.target: [Chuir sé] a Messenger [Muhammad] aithris chugat na véarsaí ar leith de Allah go bhféadfadh sé a thabhairt amach iad siúd a chreideann agus a dhéanann gníomhais righteous ó darknesses isteach sa solas.

trans-unit.source: It is Allah who has created seven heavens and of the earth, the like of them. [His] command descends among them so you may know that Allah is over all things competent and that Allah has encompassed all things in knowledge.
trans-unit.target: Is Allah a chruthaigh seacht flaithis agus an domhain, a leithéidí acu.

trans-unit.source: O Prophet, why do you prohibit [yourself from] what Allah has made lawful for you, seeking the approval of your wives? And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: O Prophet, cén fáth a bhfuil tú ag toirmeasc [féin ó] méid atá Allah déanta dleathach do shon, ag iarraidh ceadú do wives?

trans-unit.source: Allah has already ordained for you [Muslims] the dissolution of your oaths. And Allah is your protector, and He is the Knowing, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Allah Tá ordained cheana féin le haghaidh tú [Muslims] díscaoileadh do mionnaí.

trans-unit.source: And [remember] when the Prophet confided to one of his wives a statement; and when she informed [another] of it and Allah showed it to him, he made known part of it and ignored a part. And when he informed her about it, she said, "Who told you this?" He said, "I was informed by the Knowing, the Acquainted."
trans-unit.target: Agus [cuimhnigh] nuair a confided an Prophet chuig ceann de na mná céile ráiteas;

trans-unit.source: If you two [wives] repent to Allah, [it is best], for your hearts have deviated. But if you cooperate against him - then indeed Allah is his protector, and Gabriel and the righteous of the believers and the angels, moreover, are [his] assistants.
trans-unit.target: Má tá tú dhá [mná céile] aithrí chun Allah, [is fearr], do bheith bhur gcroí deviated.

trans-unit.source: Perhaps his Lord, if he divorced you [all], would substitute for him wives better than you - submitting [to Allah], believing, devoutly obedient, repentant, worshipping, and traveling - [ones] previously married and virgins.
trans-unit.target: B'fhéidir a Thiarna, má colscartha sé tú [go léir] a bheadh, in ionad dó wives níos fearr ná tú - a chur isteach [chun Allah], a chreidiúint, devoutly obedient, repentant, adhradh, agus taisteal - [cinn] pósta agus virgins roimhe.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, protect yourselves and your families from a Fire whose fuel is people and stones, over which are [appointed] angels, harsh and severe; they do not disobey Allah in what He commands them but do what they are commanded.
trans-unit.target: O agat a chreid, díbh féin agus do theaghlaigh ó Dhóiteán a breosla Is daoine agus clocha, a chosaint ar lena linn atá [ceaptha] aingeal, harsh agus dian;

trans-unit.source: O you who have disbelieved, make no excuses that Day. You will only be recompensed for what you used to do.
trans-unit.target: O sibhse a disbelieved, a dhéanamh aon leithscéal sin Day.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, repent to Allah with sincere repentance. Perhaps your Lord will remove from you your misdeeds and admit you into gardens beneath which rivers flow [on] the Day when Allah will not disgrace the Prophet and those who believed with him. Their light will proceed before them and on their right; they will say, "Our Lord, perfect for us our light and forgive us. Indeed, You are over all things competent."
trans-unit.target: O agat a chreid, repent a Allah le aithrí ó chroí.

trans-unit.source: O Prophet, strive against the disbelievers and the hypocrites and be harsh upon them. And their refuge is Hell, and wretched is the destination.
trans-unit.target: O Prophet, déanaimid aghaidh na disbelievers agus na hypocrites agus beidh harsh orthu.

trans-unit.source: Allah presents an example of those who disbelieved: the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot. They were under two of Our righteous servants but betrayed them, so those prophets did not avail them from Allah at all, and it was said, "Enter the Fire with those who enter."
trans-unit.target: Allah láthair sampla de na daoine a disbelieved: an bhean chéile Noah agus an bhean chéile de Lot.

trans-unit.source: And Allah presents an example of those who believed: the wife of Pharaoh, when she said, "My Lord, build for me near You a house in Paradise and save me from Pharaoh and his deeds and save me from the wrongdoing people."
trans-unit.target: Agus cuireann Allah sampla de na daoine a chreid: an bhean chéile de Pharaoh, nuair a dúirt sí, "Mo Thiarna, teach a thógáil dom in aice leat i Paradise agus a shábháil dom ó Pharaoh agus a gníomhais agus a shábháil dom ó na daoine éagóir."

trans-unit.source: And [the example of] Mary, the daughter of 'Imran, who guarded her chastity, so We blew into [her garment] through Our angel, and she believed in the words of her Lord and His scriptures and was of the devoutly obedient.
trans-unit.target: Agus [an sampla de] Muire, an iníon de 'Imran, a cosanta sí chastity, mar sin shéid muid isteach [h éadaigh] trí Ár aingeal, agus chreid sí i na focail ar a Tiarna agus a scrioptúir agus bhí sé ar an obedient devoutly.

trans-unit.source: Blessed is He in whose hand is dominion, and He is over all things competent -
trans-unit.target: Is beannaithe ina Is láimhe Dominion, agus tá sé níos mó ná gach rud inniúil -

trans-unit.source: [He] who created death and life to test you [as to] which of you is best in deed - and He is the Exalted in Might, the Forgiving -
trans-unit.target: [Sé] a chruthaigh bás agus saol a thástáil duit [maidir] cé acu de tú go bhfuil fearr i ghníomhas - agus tá sé an exalted sa fhéadfadh, an forgiving -

trans-unit.source: [And] who created seven heavens in layers. You do not see in the creation of the Most Merciful any inconsistency. So return [your] vision [to the sky]; do you see any breaks?
trans-unit.target: [Agus] a chruthaigh seacht flaithis i sraitheanna.

trans-unit.source: Then return [your] vision twice again. [Your] vision will return to you humbled while it is fatigued.
trans-unit.target: Ansin ar ais [do] fís dhó arís.

trans-unit.source: And We have certainly beautified the nearest heaven with stars and have made [from] them what is thrown at the devils and have prepared for them the punishment of the Blaze.
trans-unit.target: Agus tá muid beautified cinnte an spéir is gaire le réaltaí agus a mbeidh [as] dóibh céard atá thrown ag an diabhal agus a ullmhú dóibh an pionósú an Blaze.

trans-unit.source: And for those who disbelieved in their Lord is the punishment of Hell, and wretched is the destination.
trans-unit.target: Agus dóibh siúd a disbelieved ina Thiarna é an pionós de ifreann, agus tá sé wretched an ceann scríbe.

trans-unit.source: When they are thrown into it, they hear from it a [dreadful] inhaling while it boils up.
trans-unit.target: Nuair atá siad thrown isteach é, a chloiseann siad ó sé [dreadful] inhaling agus boils sé suas.

trans-unit.source: It almost bursts with rage. Every time a company is thrown into it, its keepers ask them, "Did there not come to you a warner?"
trans-unit.target: bpléascann sé beagnach le buile.

trans-unit.source: They will say," Yes, a warner had come to us, but we denied and said, 'Allah has not sent down anything. You are not but in great error.'"
trans-unit.target: Beidh siad ag rá, "Tá, a tháinig Warner chugainn, ach shéan muid agus dúirt sé, 'nach bhfuil Allah sheoladh síos rud ar bith. Níl tú ach trí dhearmad mór.'"

trans-unit.source: And they will say, "If only we had been listening or reasoning, we would not be among the companions of the Blaze."
trans-unit.target: Agus beidh siad ag rá, "Más rud é ach bhí againn éisteacht nó réasúnaíocht, ní ba mhaith linn a bheith i measc na compánaigh an Blaze."

trans-unit.source: And they will admit their sin, so [it is] alienation for the companions of the Blaze.
trans-unit.target: Agus beidh siad a ligean isteach a n-pheaca, agus mar sin [tá sé] coimhthiú do compánach an Blaze.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who fear their Lord unseen will have forgiveness and great reward.
trans-unit.target: Go deimhin, beidh dóibh siúd a eagla a unseen Tiarna maithiúnas agus ar luaíocht mór.

trans-unit.source: And conceal your speech or publicize it; indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
trans-unit.target: Agus cheilt do chuid cainte nó phoibliú;

trans-unit.source: Does He who created not know, while He is the Subtle, the Acquainted?
trans-unit.target: Níl sé ag nach cruthaíodh a fhios, cé go bhfuil sé an Subtle, an acquainted?

trans-unit.source: It is He who made the earth tame for you - so walk among its slopes and eat of His provision - and to Him is the resurrection.
trans-unit.target: Is té a rinne an tame domhain ar do shon - mar sin ag siúl i measc a fhánaí agus itheann ar chuid soláthar - agus a dó go bhfuil an aiséirí.

trans-unit.source: Do you feel secure that He who [holds authority] in the heaven would not cause the earth to swallow you and suddenly it would sway?
trans-unit.target: An mbraitheann tú slán go té [seilbh údarás] sa spéir nach mbeadh faoi deara an domhain a swallow tú agus go tobann go mbeadh sé smacht?

trans-unit.source: Or do you feel secure that He who [holds authority] in the heaven would not send against you a storm of stones? Then you would know how [severe] was My warning.
trans-unit.target: Nó a bhraitheann tú slán go té [seilbh údarás] sa spéir nach mbeadh a sheoladh in aghaidh leat stoirm clocha?

trans-unit.source: And already had those before them denied, and how [terrible] was My reproach.
trans-unit.target: Agus bhí cheana siúd sular dhiúltú dóibh, agus conas [uafásach] Mo reproach.

trans-unit.source: Do they not see the birds above them with wings outspread and [sometimes] folded in? None holds them [aloft] except the Most Merciful. Indeed He is, of all things, Seeing.
trans-unit.target: ní dhéanann siad a fheiceáil ar an éan os a gcionn le sciatháin outspread agus [uaireanta] fillte i?

trans-unit.source: Or who is it that could be an army for you to aid you other than the Most Merciful? The disbelievers are not but in delusion.
trans-unit.target: Nó a bhfuil sé d'fhéadfadh a bheith ar arm chun tú a cabhrú leat ach amháin an chuid is mó trócaire?

trans-unit.source: Or who is it that could provide for you if He withheld His provision? But they have persisted in insolence and aversion.
trans-unit.target: Nó a bhfuil sé d'fhéadfadh a chur ar fáil do duit má coinnithe siar sé a sholáthar?

trans-unit.source: Then is one who walks fallen on his face better guided or one who walks erect on a straight path?
trans-unit.target: Is ansin amháin a siúlóidí éis titim ar a aghaidh níos fearr treoraithe nó ceann a shiúlann in airde ar chosán díreach?

trans-unit.source: Say, "It is He who has produced you and made for you hearing and vision and hearts; little are you grateful."
trans-unit.target: Abair, "Tá sé sé a bhfuil a tháirgtear tú, agus rinneadh ar do shon éisteacht agus fís agus hearts. Beag go bhfuil tú buíoch"

trans-unit.source: Say, "It is He who has multiplied you throughout the earth, and to Him you will be gathered."
trans-unit.target: Abair, "Tá sé Whoever Tá iolrú tú ar fud an domhain, agus a dó a bheidh tú ag a bhailiú."

trans-unit.source: And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"
trans-unit.target: Agus deir siad, "Nuair a bhíonn an gealltanas, má ba chóir duit a bheith fírinneach?"

trans-unit.source: Say, "The knowledge is only with Allah, and I am only a clear warner."
trans-unit.target: Abair, "Is é an t-eolas ach amháin le Allah, agus tá mé ach Warner soiléir."

trans-unit.source: But when they see it approaching, the faces of those who disbelieve will be distressed, and it will be said, "This is that for which you used to call."
trans-unit.target: Ach nuair a fheiceann siad druidim é, beidh an os comhair na ndaoine a disbelieve bheith suaite, agus beidh sé a rá, "Tá sé seo go bhfuil a d'úsáid tú chun glaoch."

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "Have you considered: whether Allah should cause my death and those with me or have mercy upon us, who can protect the disbelievers from a painful punishment?"
trans-unit.target: Abair, [O Muhammad], "An bhfuil a mheas tú:? Cé acu ba chóir Allah faoi deara mo bháis agus iad siúd a bhfuil liom nó déan trócaire orainn, ar féidir leo a chosaint ar an disbelievers ó phionós painful"

trans-unit.source: Say, "He is the Most Merciful; we have believed in Him, and upon Him we have relied. And you will [come to] know who it is that is in clear error."
trans-unit.target: Abair, "Tá sé an chuid is mó trócaire; ní mór dúinn chreid i dó, agus ar Eisean againn ag brath Agus beidh tú [teacht ar] fhios ag a bhfuil sé go bhfuil trí bhotún soiléir.."

trans-unit.source: Say, "Have you considered: if your water was to become sunken [into the earth], then who could bring you flowing water?"
trans-unit.target: Abair, "An bhfuil tú a mheas: má bhí do uisce a chun bheith bháite [isteach an domhain], ansin d'fhéadfadh a thabhairt duit ag sileadh uisce?"

trans-unit.source: Nun. By the pen and what they inscribe,
trans-unit.target: Bean rialta.

trans-unit.source: You are not, [O Muhammad], by the favor of your Lord, a madman.
trans-unit.target: Nach bhfuil tú, [O Muhammad], ag an bhfabhar do Thiarna, a madman.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, for you is a reward uninterrupted.
trans-unit.target: Agus go deimhin, ar do shon go bhfuil ar luaíocht gan bhriseadh.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, you are of a great moral character.
trans-unit.target: Agus go deimhin, tá tú de chineál morálta mór.

trans-unit.source: So you will see and they will see
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, beidh tú a fheiceáil agus beidh siad a fheiceáil

trans-unit.source: Which of you is the afflicted [by a devil].
trans-unit.target: Cé acu de tú go bhfuil an afflicted [ag diabhal].

trans-unit.source: Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has gone astray from His way, and He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.
trans-unit.target: Go deimhin, tá do Thiarna is a fhios agam de a bhfuil imithe ar strae ó a bhealach, agus tá sé an chuid is mó a fhios agam de na [ceart] treoraithe.

trans-unit.source: Then do not obey the deniers.
trans-unit.target: Ní sin a dhéanamh cloí leis na deniers.

trans-unit.source: They wish that you would soften [in your position], so they would soften [toward you].
trans-unit.target: Is mian leo go mbeadh tú laghdaíonn [i do sheasamh], agus mar sin bheadh siad laghdaíonn [dtreo tú].

trans-unit.source: And do not obey every worthless habitual swearer
trans-unit.target: Agus ná obey gach swearer habitual worthless

trans-unit.source: [And] scorner, going about with malicious gossip -
trans-unit.target: [Agus] scorner, ag dul thart le gossip mailíseach -

trans-unit.source: A preventer of good, transgressing and sinful,
trans-unit.target: Tá preventer de maith, transgressing agus Nós Nua,

trans-unit.source: Cruel, moreover, and an illegitimate pretender.
trans-unit.target: Cruálach, ina theannta sin, agus pretender neamhdhlisteanach.

trans-unit.source: Because he is a possessor of wealth and children,
trans-unit.target: Toisc go bhfuil sé ina possessor an rachmais agus leanaí,

trans-unit.source: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Legends of the former peoples."
trans-unit.target: Nuair a againn véarsaí aithris dó, a deir sé, "Legends an iar- bpobal."

trans-unit.source: We will brand him upon the snout.
trans-unit.target: Déanfaimid branda air ar an smuit.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, We have tried them as We tried the companions of the garden, when they swore to cut its fruit in the [early] morning
trans-unit.target: Go deimhin, tá muid iarracht iad mar a rinne muid an compánach an ghairdín, nuair a mhionnaigh siad a ghearradh a chuid torthaí sa [luath] maidin

trans-unit.source: Without making exception.
trans-unit.target: Gan a dhéanamh eisceacht.

trans-unit.source: So there came upon the garden an affliction from your Lord while they were asleep.
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, tá tháinig ar an gairdín ar affliction ó do Thiarna fad is a bhí siad ina gcodladh.

trans-unit.source: And it became as though reaped.
trans-unit.target: Agus bhí sé mar cé reaped.

trans-unit.source: And they called one another at morning,
trans-unit.target: Agus d'iarr siad ar a chéile ar maidin,

trans-unit.source: [Saying], "Go early to your crop if you would cut the fruit."
trans-unit.target: [Ag rá], "Téigh go luath chun do barr más mian leat a ghearradh ar na torthaí."

trans-unit.source: So they set out, while lowering their voices,
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, leagann siad amach, agus ísliú a nguth,

trans-unit.source: [Saying], "There will surely not enter it today upon you [any] poor person."
trans-unit.target: [Ag rá], "Beidh surely ní dul isteach ann é a lá atá inniu ann ar tú [aon] duine bocht."

trans-unit.source: And they went early in determination, [assuming themselves] able.
trans-unit.target: Agus chuaigh siad go luath i gcinneadh, [ag glacadh iad féin] ann.

trans-unit.source: But when they saw it, they said, "Indeed, we are lost;
trans-unit.target: Ach nuair a chonaic siad é, dúirt siad, "Go deimhin, tá muid ag caillte;

trans-unit.source: Rather, we have been deprived."
trans-unit.target: Ina ionad sin, ní mór dúinn coinnithe uaidh nó uaithi. "

trans-unit.source: The most moderate of them said, "Did I not say to you, 'Why do you not exalt [Allah]?' "
trans-unit.target: An chuid is mó measartha acu sin, "Ní raibh mé a rá leat," Cén fáth a bhfuil tú exalt [Allah]? '

trans-unit.source: They said, "Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."
trans-unit.target: Dúirt siad, "Tá exalted ár dTiarna! Go deimhin, bhí muid agraíodh éagóiritheoirí."

trans-unit.source: Then they approached one another, blaming each other.
trans-unit.target: Ansin chuaigh siad ar a chéile, blaming chéile.

trans-unit.source: They said, "O woe to us; indeed we were transgressors.
trans-unit.target: Dúirt siad, "O ochón dúinn; go deimhin bhí muid transgressors.

trans-unit.source: Perhaps our Lord will substitute for us [one] better than it. Indeed, we are toward our Lord desirous."
trans-unit.target: B'fhéidir go mbeidh ár dTiarna in ionad dúinn [amháin] fearr ná é.

trans-unit.source: Such is the punishment [of this world]. And the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.
trans-unit.target: Is é sin an pionós [an tsaoil seo].

trans-unit.source: Indeed, for the righteous with their Lord are the Gardens of Pleasure.
trans-unit.target: Go deimhin, an righteous lena Thiarna iad na Gairdíní pléisiúir.

trans-unit.source: Then will We treat the Muslims like the criminals?
trans-unit.target: Ansin, beidh muid déileáil leis an Muslims cosúil leis coirpigh?

trans-unit.source: What is [the matter] with you? How do you judge?
trans-unit.target: Cad é [an t-ábhar] in éineacht leat?

trans-unit.source: Or do you have a scripture in which you learn
trans-unit.target: Nó an bhfuil tú ag scripture ina bhfoghlaimíonn tú

trans-unit.source: That indeed for you is whatever you choose?
trans-unit.target: Go deimhin do shon go bhfuil cuma cad a roghnaíonn tú?

trans-unit.source: Or do you have oaths [binding] upon Us, extending until the Day of Resurrection, that indeed for you is whatever you judge?
trans-unit.target: Nó an bhfuil tú mionnaí [ceangailteach] ar Us, leathnú go dtí an lá de Aiséirí, gur deimhin do shon go bhfuil cuma cad breitheamh tú?

trans-unit.source: Ask them which of them, for that [claim], is responsible.
trans-unit.target: Iarr orthu cé acu, chun na [éileamh], freagrach.

trans-unit.source: Or do they have partners? Then let them bring their partners, if they should be truthful.
trans-unit.target: Nó an bhfuil siad comhpháirtithe?

trans-unit.source: The Day the shin will be uncovered and they are invited to prostration but the disbelievers will not be able,
trans-unit.target: An Lá a bheidh an loigrín a nochtadh agus iad Tugtar cuireadh do faonluí ach ní bheidh na disbelievers ann,

trans-unit.source: Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. And they used to be invited to prostration while they were sound.
trans-unit.target: A súile humbled, beidh náiriú iad a chlúdach.

trans-unit.source: So leave Me, [O Muhammad], with [the matter of] whoever denies the Qur'an. We will progressively lead them [to punishment] from where they do not know.
trans-unit.target: Mar sin fág Me, [O Muhammad], le [an t-ábhar ar] whoever denies an Qur'an.

trans-unit.source: And I will give them time. Indeed, My plan is firm.
trans-unit.target: Agus beidh mé a thabhairt dóibh am.

trans-unit.source: Or do you ask of them a payment, so they are by debt burdened down?
trans-unit.target: Nó bhfuil tú ag iarraidh iad íocaíocht, ionas go bhfuil siad ag fiach burdened síos?

trans-unit.source: Or have they [knowledge of] the unseen, so they write [it] down?
trans-unit.target: Nó tá siad [eolas] an unseen, mar sin scríobhann siad [é] síos?

trans-unit.source: Then be patient for the decision of your Lord, [O Muhammad], and be not like the companion of the fish when he called out while he was distressed.
trans-unit.target: Ansin a n-othar leis an gcinneadh ar do Thiarna, [O Muhammad], agus a bheith cosúil leis an compánach an t-iasc nuair a chuaigh sé amach nuair a bhí sé i bponc.

trans-unit.source: If not that a favor from his Lord overtook him, he would have been thrown onto the naked shore while he was censured.
trans-unit.target: Más rud é nach bhfuil i dtús báire as a Thiarna do breith air, bheadh sé thrown isteach ar an gcladach naked nuair a bhí sé cháineadh.

trans-unit.source: And his Lord chose him and made him of the righteous.
trans-unit.target: Agus roghnaigh a Thiarna dó agus rinne sé ar an righteous.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, those who disbelieve would almost make you slip with their eyes when they hear the message, and they say, "Indeed, he is mad."
trans-unit.target: Agus go deimhin, iad siúd a disbelieve Ba mhaith a dhéanamh nach mór duit duillín lena súile nuair a chloiseann siad an teachtaireacht, agus deir siad, "Go deimhin, tá sé ar buile."

trans-unit.source: But it is not except a reminder to the worlds.
trans-unit.target: Ach nach bhfuil sé ach amháin i gcuimhne do na saol.

trans-unit.source: The Inevitable Reality -
trans-unit.target: An Réaltacht Dosheachanta -

trans-unit.source: What is the Inevitable Reality?
trans-unit.target: Cad é an Réaltacht Dosheachanta?

trans-unit.source: And what can make you know what is the Inevitable Reality?
trans-unit.target: Agus cad is féidir a dhéanamh a fhios agat cad é an Réaltacht Dosheachanta?

trans-unit.source: Thamud and 'Aad denied the Striking Calamity.
trans-unit.target: Thamud agus 'AAD Shéan an Calamity buailte.

trans-unit.source: So as for Thamud, they were destroyed by the overpowering [blast].
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, mar do Thamud, bhí siad scriosta ag an overpowering [soinneáin].

trans-unit.source: And as for 'Aad, they were destroyed by a screaming, violent wind
trans-unit.target: Agus mar do 'AAD, bhí scriosta siad ag screadaíl, gaoth foréigneach

trans-unit.source: Which Allah imposed upon them for seven nights and eight days in succession, so you would see the people therein fallen as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees.
trans-unit.target: Cén Allah fhorchuirtear orthu ar feadh seacht oíche agus ocht lá i ndiaidh a chéile, agus mar sin ba mhaith leat a fheiceáil ar na daoine tar éis titim ann amhail is dá mba trunks log na gcrann pailme.

trans-unit.source: Then do you see of them any remains?
trans-unit.target: Ansin a fheiceann tú iad ar aon iarsmaí?

trans-unit.source: And there came Pharaoh and those before him and the overturned cities with sin.
trans-unit.target: Agus tháinig Pharaoh agus iad siúd os a chomhair agus na cathracha ar ceal le pheaca.

trans-unit.source: And they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them with a seizure exceeding [in severity].
trans-unit.target: Agus disobeyed siad an teachtaire a Thiarna, mar sin ghabh sé iad le taom mó [i déine].

trans-unit.source: Indeed, when the water overflowed, We carried your ancestors in the sailing ship
trans-unit.target: Go deimhin, nuair a overflowed an t-uisce, rinne muid do sinsear ar an long seoltóireachta

trans-unit.source: That We might make it for you a reminder and [that] a conscious ear would be conscious of it.
trans-unit.target: Go bhféadfadh muid a dhéanamh ar do shon i gcuimhne agus [go] mbeadh cluas comhfhiosach a bheith feasach ar sé.

trans-unit.source: Then when the Horn is blown with one blast
trans-unit.target: Ansin, nuair a bhíonn an Corn séidte le ceann amháin soinneáin

trans-unit.source: And the earth and the mountains are lifted and leveled with one blow -
trans-unit.target: Agus an domhan agus na sléibhte atá lifted agus leveled le ceann amháin buille -

trans-unit.source: Then on that Day, the Resurrection will occur,
trans-unit.target: Ansin, ar a Lá, beidh an aiséirí tarlú,

trans-unit.source: And the heaven will split [open], for that Day it is infirm.
trans-unit.target: Agus beidh an spéir scoilt [oscailte], don Lá is easlán.

trans-unit.source: And the angels are at its edges. And there will bear the Throne of your Lord above them, that Day, eight [of them].
trans-unit.target: Agus tá na haingil ag a himill.

trans-unit.source: That Day, you will be exhibited [for judgement]; not hidden among you is anything concealed.
trans-unit.target: Go Lá, beidh tú ar taispeáint [haghaidh breithiúnais];

trans-unit.source: So as for he who is given his record in his right hand, he will say, "Here, read my record!
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, mar do té tugtha chuid taifead ina láimh dheis, beidh sé ag rá, "Anseo, léamh mo thaifead!

trans-unit.source: Indeed, I was certain that I would be meeting my account."
trans-unit.target: Go deimhin, bhí mé cinnte go mbeadh mé ag bualadh mo chuntas. "

trans-unit.source: So he will be in a pleasant life -
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, beidh sé a bheith i saol taitneamhach -

trans-unit.source: In an elevated garden,
trans-unit.target: I gairdín ardaithe,

trans-unit.source: Its [fruit] to be picked hanging near.
trans-unit.target: A [torthaí] a roghnaíodh crochadh in aice.

trans-unit.source: [They will be told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you put forth in the days past."
trans-unit.target: [Beidh siad in iúl], "Eat agus deoch i sásamh do méid a chuir tú amach i an lá anuas."

trans-unit.source: But as for he who is given his record in his left hand, he will say, "Oh, I wish I had not been given my record
trans-unit.target: Ach de réir mar le té tugtha chuid taifead ina lámh clé, beidh sé ag rá, "Oh, ba mhaith liom nach raibh mé tugtha mo thaifead

trans-unit.source: And had not known what is my account.
trans-unit.target: Agus ní raibh ar eolas a bhfuil mo chuntas.

trans-unit.source: I wish my death had been the decisive one.
trans-unit.target: Is mian liom go raibh mo bháis bhí an ceann cinntitheach.

trans-unit.source: My wealth has not availed me.
trans-unit.target: Nach bhfuil mo stór leas dom.

trans-unit.source: Gone from me is my authority."
trans-unit.target: Imithe ó dom m'údarás. "

trans-unit.source: [Allah will say], "Seize him and shackle him.
trans-unit.target: [Beidh Allah rá], "Ghabháil dó agus shackle air.

trans-unit.source: Then into Hellfire drive him.
trans-unit.target: Ansin Hellfire isteach tiomáint air.

trans-unit.source: Then into a chain whose length is seventy cubits insert him."
trans-unit.target: Ansin isteach i slabhra a bhfuil seachtó fad cubhad isteach air. "

trans-unit.source: Indeed, he did not used to believe in Allah, the Most Great,
trans-unit.target: Go deimhin, ní raibh sé in úsáid chun a chreidiúint i Allah, an chuid is mó Mór,

trans-unit.source: Nor did he encourage the feeding of the poor.
trans-unit.target: Ná ní raibh sé ag spreagadh an bheathú na mbocht.

trans-unit.source: So there is not for him here this Day any devoted friend
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, nach bhfuil ann dó anseo an Lá ar bith chara dírithe

trans-unit.source: Nor any food except from the discharge of wounds;
trans-unit.target: Ná aon bhia amháin ó urscaoileadh wounds;

trans-unit.source: None will eat it except the sinners.
trans-unit.target: Beidh aon cheann itheann sé ach amháin an peacaigh.

trans-unit.source: So I swear by what you see
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, I swear ag an méid a fheiceann tú

trans-unit.source: And what you do not see
trans-unit.target: Agus cad é nach bhfuil tú a fheiceáil

trans-unit.source: [That] indeed, the Qur'an is the word of a noble Messenger.
trans-unit.target: [Go] go deimhin, is é an Qur'an an focal ar Messenger uasal.

trans-unit.source: And it is not the word of a poet; little do you believe.
trans-unit.target: Agus nach bhfuil sé an focal file;

trans-unit.source: Nor the word of a soothsayer; little do you remember.
trans-unit.target: Ná an focal ar soothsayer;

trans-unit.source: [It is] a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: [Is] revelation as an Tiarna de na saol.

trans-unit.source: And if Muhammad had made up about Us some [false] sayings,
trans-unit.target: Agus dá mbeadh Muhammad suas thart Linne roinnt [bréagach] sayings,

trans-unit.source: We would have seized him by the right hand;
trans-unit.target: Ba mhaith linn a urghabháil dó ag an lámh dheas;

trans-unit.source: Then We would have cut from him the aorta.
trans-unit.target: Ansin, ba mhaith linn a bheith gearrtha uaidh an aorta.

trans-unit.source: And there is no one of you who could prevent [Us] from him.
trans-unit.target: Agus nach bhfuil aon cheann de tú d'fhéadfadh a cosc a chur ar [Us] uaidh.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, the Qur'an is a reminder for the righteous.
trans-unit.target: Agus go deimhin, is é an Qur'an i gcuimhne do na righteous.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, We know that among you are deniers.
trans-unit.target: Agus go deimhin, tá a fhios againn go bhfuil i measc tú deniers.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, it will be [a cause of] regret upon the disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Agus go deimhin, beidh sé [cúis] brón ar na disbelievers.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, it is the truth of certainty.
trans-unit.target: Agus go deimhin, is é an fhírinne cinnteachta.

trans-unit.source: So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, exalt an t-ainm de do Thiarna, Mór an chuid is mó.

trans-unit.source: A supplicant asked for a punishment bound to happen
trans-unit.target: A supplicant iarr pionós cheangal le tarlú

trans-unit.source: To the disbelievers; of it there is no preventer.
trans-unit.target: Chun na disbelievers;

trans-unit.source: [It is] from Allah, owner of the ways of ascent.
trans-unit.target: [Is] ó Allah, úinéir an bealaí ascent.

trans-unit.source: The angels and the Spirit will ascend to Him during a Day the extent of which is fifty thousand years.
trans-unit.target: Beidh na haingil agus an Spiorad ascend dó le linn Lá an méid atá caoga míle bliain.

trans-unit.source: So be patient with gracious patience.
trans-unit.target: Mar sin, a n-othar le foighne gracious.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, they see it [as] distant,
trans-unit.target: Go deimhin, a fheiceann siad é [mar] bhfad i gcéin,

trans-unit.source: But We see it [as] near.
trans-unit.target: Ach Feicimid é [mar] gar.

trans-unit.source: On the Day the sky will be like murky oil,
